He won't say why, or speak to anyone but you. However, Thanaton clearly prized him--he received significant resources for his "research."
Do we know anything about what he's doing on Rishi?
One of Thanaton's prized dogs wants me in person on Rishi? Surely he wouldn't be so obvious?
Veijel did serve Thanaton's predecessor, as well--he may truly be loyal.
When one of my servants wishes to speak with me, I expect to be informed.
Respectfully, you receive dozens of requests daily, most of no import. I sought only to avoid a deluge.
Veijel was designated a "seeker into matters exotic and arcane." Quite a few of your researchers have this designation.
Whether Veijel's work is productive or--like certain other legacy projects--mere eccentricity is not for me to judge.
Where do I find him?
I'll send coordinates. Perhaps your archaeologist might assess Veijel's work with some insight as well.
Then you are dismissed.
My life for yours, Dark Lord.
Hello? Hello? Are you the Grand Champion?
Who is this?
I'm Thera Markon. Crysta's daughter. She was your handler, right? On the Great Hunt?
I heard you were on Rishi. I want to meet with you. Crysta's dead.
Let's talk.
Crysta never mentioned you, and a lot of people have this frequency. A lot of people don't like me.
This isn't a trap. I know you'd shoot me--that's what you do!
This isn't the Great Hunt, and I don't work with Crysta anymore. Get off this channel.
No! Absolutely not.
Look, without Crysta, you'd still be on Dromund Kaas. Without Crysta, you wouldn't have a ship. You may work for Sith now, but you didn't always.
Besides, I'm not asking a favor. I'm offering a job.
All right. We'll meet.
Name a time and place. I'll be there.
In that case, we have something to discuss. Been a while since I worked outside the Empire.
I've got a room at the cantina. I'll be drinking. Bring your slicer if you want to check my story--just come soon as you can.
Am I really a person you want to make angry?
Of course not. I'm--look, I'm just on edge.
Please, one meeting, and you can walk away. I'm at the cantina. Bring your slicer if you want to check my story.
Warning! Adequate encryption has not been verified. Transmission interception is possible.
Please confirm identity. I am authorized only to speak with "the Red Blade."
This is the Red Blade. You want to tell me what's going on?
Maybe I'm the Red Blade. Maybe I'm not. Who's calling?
Partial authorization granted. I carry a message from your loyal associate "Jheeg."
Let's hear the message.
No audio available. Your loyal associate requests a meeting at the attached coordinates.
You're on the wrong frequency. I don't know any Red Blade.
Verbal identification: Rejected. Facial recognition: Confirmed.
Master Blade, I am to inform you that your loyal associate Jheeg awaits you at the attached coordinates.
Please proceed with all appropriate haste. Also: Welcome back to Rishi after your long sojourn on Hutta!
The Nova Blades fear you, as they should. Now take the Aggressor.
I'd say the Nova Blades are properly distracted, wouldn't you?
That would be an understatement. Theron's been monitoring communications; you've caused quite a stir.
Want some gratification? Here, check this out. Just recorded.
They're blasting up my supplies, my foot soldiers! Taking my workers! What are you people prepared to do about it?
This appears to be your problem, not ours.
How would you like it if I made it your personal problem? Gimme Revan! I wanna talk to Revan!
No, I don't think so.
You don't put Revan on, the Nova Blades stop rerouting galactic traffic. That ain't negotiable.
Commodore Margok, are you threatening to alter the terms of our deal?
I paid you to do a job and you've done it well, but that's over now. I no longer have any use for your Nova Blades.
Hey, I know Torch and her Mandalorian clan up and left us, but the Blades still got a lot to offer.
Not if you don't have your own house in order. Put an end to the upstart causing you trouble and I'll consider resuming our alliance.
You really did it. You got them running scared.
Of course.
That's the only way this was ever gonna go.
Naturally. You were expecting some other outcome?
Guess it was silly of me to question, huh?
Margok said something about Mandalorians. Sure hope I'm not going to have to face my own.
We don't know much about that yet. Let's take things one step at a time.
Margok mentioned Mandalorians. Do you know anything about that?
Heard the name Torch before, but not much else. I'm looking into it.
This is no time to let up. I'm going to get back out there and finish this.
Now, not to sell you short or anything--don't think this'll be a cakewalk all of a sudden.
The Nova Blades still have an impressive roster of hardened criminals at their disposal, and the Aggressor is still heavily fortified.
The Aggressor's their headquarters. You've seen it--a crashed ship Margok turned into a fortress. Can't get in without the proper security codes.
That won't be a problem for me.
We'll get Jakarro to lend a hand all the same.
If nothing else, the activity will keep him from picking apart Deefour any futher.
The Nova Blades have to believe you're a legitimate threat to their supremacy. Show them you are.
Lana Beniko.
The Emperor's Wrath. Good to see you again. Any... word from your namesake?
Nothing has changed, if that's what you're asking.
Pretty cagey. Think you'd be more open with Lana after all she's sacrificed for your Empire.
Right now, I'd rather hear what you've been up to. It's been too long.
You should know it's a dangerous thing to pry.
No, no, you're doing it wrong. Howling Tempest Gang pirates are way less uptight.
Dark Lord. An honor, as ever. And how fares the Dark Council?
No matter the obstacles we come to face, we endure.
You're a confident one, I'll give you that....
Forget about the Dark Council. I'd much rather discuss how you've been since last we met.
It would be far better off were it operating under my own agenda.
I thought to myself, "Now that sounds like something a Sith would say," and sure enough.
The hunter arrives--just as I'd hoped you would. I trust Rishi has been to your liking?
Sandy beaches, shimmering waters, whole bunch of clowns think they're tougher than me--I could get used to it here.
Then maybe you haven't smelled a Skarkla's breath yet. Or maybe you have, I don't know.
Now that I know you're here, what's not to like?
I know you were going to find some backwater to hide out in, but this is a bit much.
You'd be hurting our feelings--if we actually had anything to do with picking this place.
Commander. Pleased to see you again. I hope you'll forgive the cloak-and-dagger routine. You must grow tired of it.
It's actually been a refreshing change of pace to impersonate a legendary outlaw.
Good to hear; you'll be doing more of it.
I'll make an exception this time--for you.
I see you haven't changed. Good.
It must be true, what they say about absence and the heart....
Not interrupting anything, am I? Just kidding; I don't really care.
This pirate cover of yours has been pretty tedious, frankly.
You can thank me for the cover--or blame me, if that's what does it for you.
And you are...?
This is Theron Shan. He's been invaluable in my efforts to investigate a most serious threat, and in bringing you here.
Why exactly am I here? And why are you here, for that matter?
I discovered that Darth Arkous had us raid the Jedi Temple to acquire technology he could use to harm the Empire.
Along with a high-ranking Republic officer who led the assault on Korriban, Darth Arkous was working for a dangerous cult known as the Order of Revan.
The Order of Revan's no secret to me--I had a run-in with them on Dromund Kaas.
An earlier incarnation, perhaps--but this is a new breed of Revanite.
I feel I should have heard of this order.
These Revanites follow the teachings of Revan--a former Sith Lord who later became a Jedi Knight, in case you didn't know.
Between what I've dug up through the SIS and what Lana's found on your end, the Republic and Empire are both riddled with undercover Revanites.
You're with the Republic?
Yeah, that's right. Are we gonna have a problem?
If Lana vouches for you, that will be good enough.
Really. Gotta say I'm surprised, but hey--I won't tempt fate or anything. Glad we can work together.
I have a feeling we'll get along.
Nice to hear.
I'm just supposed to trust a Republic spy? I don't think so.
Hey, I'm in the same boat you are. I've got traitors, you've got traitors, and they're teaming up to tear us apart.
We're in this together. Believe me, this is our best option by far.
Now that all that's out the way, let's get to the heart of the matter.
I have discovered that Darth Arkous was secretly working for a dangerous cult known as the Order of Revan.
Hello, Theron.
Is that a good hello or a bad one? Outside of Lana, I can never tell with you Imperial types.
The Empire's a lucrative client, but they don't own me.
Okay, if you say so....
Be grateful I'm working with you and leave it at that.
So definitely a good hello. Got it.
If we're to succeed here, we'll need to cooperate a great deal. I suggest we don't antagonize one another.
Yeah, okay. Well, in the spirit of cooperation, I'll get things rolling.
You've shown you want the Revanites stopped as much as anyone. That makes you an ally.
Good. Glad we're clear on that front, because here we go.
[Flirt] I think you know....
Are you really asking me that after the last time I saw you?
Okay, point taken.
I'm very glad to see you, Theron.
Really. Okay, good to know.
Now that we're all reunited, perhaps we should get things underway.
Right, yeah. Let's get to it.
[Remain silent]
Right. Okay. Moving on....
The Revanites are here--on Rishi. That's why we led you here under false pretenses. They can't know we're on to them.
Darth Arkous and Colonel Darok have brought their Infinite Army here?
No, Arkous and Darok--they're dead. Taken out in a raid on Rakata Prime. We destroyed the Revanites' whole cyborg manufacturing network.
But what we discovered there.... Revan is alive. Alive, and leading the Revanites.
I watched him take his last breath and say his last words.
How can he be alive? Wasn't he killed in an Imperial assault?
He claims to have been reborn. He also claims that he only wishes to save the galaxy, but at what terrible price?
The good news--for you--is he'll destroy the Republic in the process. Bad news is he'll destroy the Empire, too. He has to be stopped.
We need you to go out there and make life hard for the Revanites' allies--the Nova Blades.
I know the Nova Blades are running things in Raider's Cove, but how are they helping the Revanites?
If the Revanites are operating out of Rishi, then it stands to reason their leader is here.
That's our suspicion, too, but we can't say for sure just yet.
I'll decide what I "need" to do.
Hey, easy. I'm not making demands, okay?
Theron and I have a plan. Please, hear us out.
From what we've been able to gather, the Revanites' agents in the Empire and Republic have been feeding the Nova Blades intel on ship activity.
The Blades then use that intel to ambush military patrols and key shipping lanes on both sides. They're essentially remapping hyperroutes.
We should be taking the fight to the Order of Revan directly.
If we knew where on this planet they were situated, we would do just that.
What good does that do them?
That's what we'd like to find out.
[Say nothing]
Hate to admit it, but I haven't been able to remotely slice the Blades' computers. I have to have their security shut down.
The trouble is, we can't have any suspicion raised that our attack is related to the Revanites' activities.
If I assault the Nova Blades as a member of this Howling Tempest Gang, all suspicion is averted.
So I am meant to be some base pirate who has a "beef" with the Nova Blades.
I light into the Blades like some big-time, greedy pirate and no one's the wiser.
Hence the cover. I should appear to be after the Nova Blades, and the Nova Blades alone.
Yeah, you've got it exactly. Bust up their operations, get their attention, make yourself look legitimate--and then go for the throat.
We have a trusted source who's determined that the Nova Blades' base, a wrecked ship called the Aggressor, contains their entire security apparatus. That's our final target.
Where do I start?
That's the spirit!
It would be nice to know a little more about what I'm getting myself into.
The Nova Blades built Raider's Cove, so they get a piece of every kind of action going on here.
They're well funded, well staffed and protective as all get-out of the empire they've built here. Empire with a small "e", of course.
Yes, of course.
And who might that be?
Someone we trust with our lives.
Someone you already know.
Two someones, if we're being precise.
We'll place you in range of the first Nova Blade target; that's where our source is waiting.
May the Force serve you well.
It really is good to see you again.
Been hiding out a long time. It's nice to see someone who isn't a complete stranger. Good luck out there.
Yes. May the Force serve you well.
Lana Beniko...?
Am I supposed to know you?
My name is Lana Beniko. I am a Sith Lord, though I have no interest in the title.
I used to serve as advisor to Darth Arkous of the Dark Council--until he was revealed as a traitor and consequently executed.
First I'm hearing it.
How is it I'm just learning of this now?
I apologize for that being the case, Wrath. The truth is hardly anyone knows what I'm about to tell you.
A member of the Dark Council is executed and I learn of it on some backwater?
I'm afraid that's correct, Dark Lord. Understand, though, that hardly anyone knows what I'm telling you now.
And here I thought I was plugged in to all the juicy gossip.
Yes, well--everything I'm telling you remains unknown to most, hunter.
There's very little that escapes my notice. You'd think I'd have found out about this by now.
Certainly, Commander. Once I've explained further, I believe you'll understand.
You almost sound like you're about to explain all this craziness on your own....
You could advise me instead if you want....
I'll keep that in mind.
Haven't gotten into all the details yet, have you?
You're just in time; I was about to start.
Good riddance.
Last thing the Empire needs is some two-timer mucking up the works.
I'm inclined to agree, hunter.
Whoever ended his pathetic life did us a favor.
Yes, my lord.
Yes, Commander.
If the problem ended with Arkous, that would be great, right? But it doesn't.
We'll meet you at the Rishi village. Hurry along.
I could have caught up!
We can't afford to be so reckless, Jakarro! Losing Theron is bad enough--what if we'd lost you, too?
Now, now, everyone stay calm... Queen Lina of Onderon once faced a similar predicament, and her solution was quite creative!
Shut up, droid!
What's going on? Where's Theron?
He was captured. The Nova Blades data listed a Revanite safehouse here in town, and when we tried to investigate....
There were only ten of them! We saw it happen, but she used her Sith wizardry to hold me back!
Theron is the only one the Revanites saw. They may not know about the rest of us. If so, we need to maintain that advantage.
If we move quickly, we may be able to catch up before the Revanites disappear again.
They already have. Please, this is not the time for reckless heroics.
You made a tough call. But I think it was probably the right one.
And I think it was cowardly! Jakarro does not back down from a fight!
Between the two of you, there was no hope of rescuing him? I don't buy that for a second.
That's not the point! Whether we saved him or not, the attempt would have revealed us to the enemy, and then we'd be running now instead of completing our mission!
I really think you're all much too worried. They took him alive! That's a good sign!
They're probably just torturing him a bit, maybe doing some interrogation... where he could tell them about us... oh no!
That won't be an issue. Theron has several discreet implants to help him ignore pain and chemical manipulation.
A powerful Force user may still be able to learn what he knows.
What if Revan or one of his followers use the Force? Couldn't they read his mind?
I've never been able to--yes, I've tried, I'm sure it's no surprise.
Theron's mind is highly ordered, very... resolute. Probably due to his childhood training by the Jedi.
He'll keep our secrets, and we will rescue him. But right now, we need to focus and think it all through--just like he would.
You're right--we need to stick to the mission. When we find the Revanites, we'll find Theron.
Precisely. If we're fortunate, he may even learn a bit about their plans.
I trusted Theron. I don't trust you.
Trust that I want to defeat the Revanites just as badly as you do.
Arguing and killing each other is pointless! We need to be killing Revanites!
Now: what did you learn from the Mandalorians?
Revan has a hidden fleet here on Rishi. He's preparing for some kind of battle.
A hidden fleet, pirates altering shipping lanes... that's it! They aren't just affecting the shipping lanes, they're also changing Imperial and Republic patrol paths.
Revan is trying to draw them into a battle.
Here, over Rishi. With his own ships in the mix, both fleets could be devastated.
That must be his goal. Weakening both sides so that he can make his own play.
We have to find some way to interfere.
I know where to find them!
What? How? Explain, droid!
After they caught Theron, I intercepted their transmissions. After that, triangulating their base was a simple calculation. I completed it almost eighty-seven seconds ago!
They're on a small island, not far from here. The native Rishii have a trading village on the same island. I'm sure they'd give us comfortable lodging.
Then let's go.
We need to clean up any trail we might have left here. You go on--we'll meet you shortly.
Oh, I used to love cleaning....
I hope these Mandalorians are in a talkative mood.
The Aggressor may look like a junk heap, but the Nova Blades have added quite a bit of security over the years. Be cautious.
It's good to have your assistance again. The Nova Blades' information will be in our hands very soon, I can sense it.
Hit's away!
Fire, Jakarro!
Circuits crossed for collateral damage!
Here it comes!
I was hoping you'd pick that one...!
Jakarro tells me that should be enough to get the Nova Blades' attention.
There's a Lieutenant Donovarr in charge here, according to Theron. Challenging him would make a fine exclamation mark.
Have we met?
Well, look at this, Scoundrels! A visit from....
He's with the Howling Tempest Gang.
She's with the Howling Tempest Gang.
They're with the Howling Tempest Gang.
I was making a dramatic pause, Tomota. I know it's the Hurling Tempest!
Kai Zykken. I'm sure you've heard my name, most commonly accompanied by a longing sigh from one of my former conquests.
Now, here's the deal: the Corellian Run Scoundrels may owe you a debt, but it's not coming out of my hide. Take it up with accounting.
You will give me every last credit your people owe the Howling Tempest Gang. Every last one. Understood?
Well, I do speak Basic, so yeah, understood, and, you know, this, it doesn't have to get dialed up right away to "violent"....
Not even for me?
Well, when you put it like that....
Nah, actually, pirate scum doesn't really do it for me, you know? I'm more of a wealthy socialite kinda guy.
I don't know where everyone got the idea I belong to some gang, but I'm sick of hearing it.
Wait, you're saying you're not.... But that doesn't.... Oh, you're just trying to confuse me!
Way too late for that.
What? Was that a slam? Did you just slam me?
Kai, think about who recently put an end to Gorro's life. Gorro, who you hired. Full disclosure time.
Okay, alright. Listen, we can't pay. The freedom to operate in Raider's Cove isn't exactly free. After the Nova Blades take their cut, we're tapped.
Now, before you get an itch, I do have something of value. Something I know you want.
Quit stalling and start talking.
Excuses and sob stories don't change anything. If you don't have the money, you'll have to get creative.
I'm telling you, this is worth more to you than what we owe! I swear.
You tried to have me killed. I don't see why I shouldn't return the sentiment.
I get it, you're not happy with me. But you might be after this.
I record all my holocalls, and that includes the one that warned me you were coming to Rishi. I'll show it to you. Tomota, get my datapad.
You mean your personal datapad? The one you told me you lost?
Oh. That's bad, Tomota. That's--that's bad.
The personal datapad I already told you I had stored in a tracking case so you didn't lose it again?
Oh! Right! Yes! Thank you, Tomota. I knew there was a reason I kept you around....
Here. You can find and unlock the case with this tracer. And you can even keep the datapad, how's that?
Provided I get the information you promised, we have a deal.
Can't argue with that. Guessing you wouldn't let me if I tried.
You Howling Temple Club folks, you're not so bad after all.
How about you go find the datapad you lost and bring it to me?
Hey, good idea. Why don't I go ahead and, you know, do that.
If Kai leaves for the case, he won't come back with it. He'll be long gone.
Oh, like you wouldn't do the same.
You have a point.
Never mind. I'll find it myself.
Good choice.
I hope you tell your Howling Teapot Gang we're even now.
I'll take your datapad, but that doesn't mean I'm done with you.
Kai was not lying. We have little else to give.
You would be better off calling in the debt with our fellow Scoundrels in the Corellian sector.
Gotta hand it to you, the Whirling Tempest Crew don't mess around.
Howling Tempest Gang.
Right. That's what I said.
Kai Zykken?
Huh? I... uh... no speak Basic. Uh... nee wonna... wonga?
I don't think it's working, boss.
And neither did Gorro, apparently! This is not my day... hello! Yes, I am indeed Kai Zykken. Though there are probably lots of people with that name. Just saying.
You don't have to be afraid. I'm not who you think I am--I just want information.
Yeah. Information on getting your credits back. C'mon, this isn't my first shakedown.
You know why I've come! Nobody messes with the Red Hulls!
Of course! A debt's a debt, and my word is my vow!
I hear you've been telling people about me. Lying about me. I want to know why.
You mean Gorro? I just... you know... mentioned to him how I owed you. Just making conversation!
You don't really need those credits now, do you? As in, "now" now?
We've never even met before. How could you possibly owe me credits?
I... what? Is that rhetorical? We never met in person, but we still had a deal. I know. I'm not trying to worm my way out of it!
I want what I'm owed, Zykken. I'm not leaving without my credits.
See, the problem with me paying you is that I can't.
Tell you what--instead of credits, how about I tell you who warned me that you were coming?
That's got to be worth something, right? So you can go after whoever sold you out, and I can stay in one piece?
Pay your debt in information. I want to know who told you about me. Don't make me ask again.
Oh, well, if that's all you want... there was someone who tipped me off that you were coming....
Go on.
It's... uh... it was a message, so I saved it on my datapad....
The one you always lose?
Yeah! Oh....
I put it in the lockbox.
Great! He put it in the lockbox! It's all yours. Anything else in there too, you just help yourself.
A deal's a deal, even when it's a steal. A steal for you, I mean--not us.
I--I know who you are. I'll tell you whatever you wanna know.
Go away.
Scoundrels forever!
Talk to me.
I want some information.
I'm looking for someone.
You didn't hear it from me, okay?
Ain't happening.
Huge mistake, coming here!
No way am I getting in your way....
Uhh... no.
I'm gonna be a legendary pirate killer!
Just don't hurt me!
Back off!
Yeah, fine, like I care.
My lips are sealed as of right... now.
You're so dead!
Talk to Kai. He is in charge here, believe it or not.
If you are lucky, you will find the datapad before the Carida Corsairs do.
Kai Zykken, greetings. I speak to you now to deliver a warning.
The Howling Tempest Gang is one of the galaxy's most feared pirate associations. They have just now set their sights on Rishi.
As you know, the Corellian Run Scoundrels owe the Howling Tempest Gang a great many credits. There is no telling what will happen when you are discovered.
I suggest you herald the gang's arrival to draw unwanted attention on them; I'm dispatching several droids across Raider's Cove to do the same.
Or you could do nothing and suffer the consequences. The choice is yours.
Kai Zykken? Greetings. I have important information for you.
The Red Hulls may be the galaxy's most bloodthirsty and sadistic pirate crew. And they're heading toward Rishi.
I'm sure you remember the debt that you owe the Red Hulls. Quite a few credits... not something they're likely to forget.
My droids are spreading word of their arrival. If you were to do the same... they might be too distracted to come after you.
The choice is yours, of course.
What in the...?
Hey! He's with me!
You best respect the Corsairs' property!
Hands off the monkey-lizard!
You'll leave us be if you know what's good for you....
Had enough of your snooping around Corsair territory. You're going down!
The job's done.
Excellent news, but it's only our first step.
One of the Nova Blades mentioned a slave camp. Somewhere remote. We should strike there next.
Good call, actually. I ran across some chatter about that place.
Someone called Margok is in charge of the Nova Blades. He'll get us closer to the Revanites.
Yes, he will--but he's safely inside his headquarters. We must set his operations into a state of disarray, send his forces scattering.
Did you have something in mind?
I intercepted some chatter about a slave camp--well, more like a slave island.
I heard one of their lieutenants mention it.
Basically, anyone in Raider's Cove who doesn't give the Nova Blades a slice of their action or whatever gets locked away.
Some get put into hazardous labor--like mining--but most are sold as slaves to visitors from offworld. It's a lucrative business for the Blades.
Not anymore.
You got that right.
Give me the coordinates and I'll get started.
It's not that simple; we don't actually know where the slave island is.
So, just like their supply cache, if I destroy the assets they're left with nothing.
Whoa--if you're suggesting what I think you are...!
As you said yourself, these slaves are assets. They're also enemies of the Nova Blades, which makes them all the more valuable to us alive.
You'll have to slip in with one of the Nova Blades' cargo shipments. I'm sure the island's heavily guarded, so try not to get killed.
I believe Theron means to say he's concerned for your safety--as am I. May the Force serve you well.
Theron, do you read me? The supply cache has been destroyed.
Theron? Our task is complete.
Havoc to base. Objective complete.
Hey there. I don't know if you guys have heard, but the Red Hulls just completely trashed a Nova Blade supply cache.
I understand the main suspect is being described as "skilled and extremely attractive."
Nice work.
I believe one more assault on the Nova Blades' holdings should be enough to solidify our "pirate feud" and disguise our true goal.
One of the Blades mentioned a slave camp. Do you know anything about it?
We do. You remember me saying that the Nova Blades basically run things around here? For the most part, they're pretty hands-off.
But if someone stands up to them, or fails to pay their "fees" to live here? The Blades grab them and ship them off to the slave camp.
The slaves are a substantial part of the Nova Blades' income, both through their labor in hazardous mines and as merchandise for offworld slave traders.
According to our information, the slaves are kept on a remote island under heavy guard. Do you think you can manage to free them?
No one should have to suffer in slavery. I'll take care of it.
You really aren't like other Sith, are you?
I like to think I'm my own woman.
Is this some kind of trick?
Sith do not free slaves. They kill them, or capture them for their own use. What's your game here, Lana?
You're joking. A Sith who wants to free slaves? You expect me to believe that?
This is not some kind of elaborate deception. Freeing them contributes to our goals. It's that simple.
Since we don't know the island's exact coordinates, your best bet is to stow away in one of the shipping containers the Nova Blades take out there.
Once you reach the slave camp, you can catch them by surprise, break up the security, and free as many as possible.
All in a day's work for a noble Jedi, yes?
Just another day for the hero of Havoc Squad, yes?
Certainly nothing a daring star pilot can't handle, yes?
It's like a warzone, Commodore! We're gonna lose everything if we don't airlift what's left to the slave camp!
We're not backing down just because some upstart crew thinks they got what it takes to break us.
Buckle down! Be a Nova Blade! And kill whoever's messing with us!
But, Commodore Margok...!
Go tell your commodore and anyone else who'll listen that the Howling Tempest Gang is taking over Raider's Cove.
Tell me everything you know about the Revanites and this ends.
Oh, it's about to end, but not how you want.
Go tell the commodore and the rest of the Blades that the Red Hulls are in charge now.
Heard stories about you. Dropped Gorro. Put a fright into that weasel Zykken....
We don't have to fight. Just tell me what you know about the Revanites.
Oh, yeah, sure. Why don't I go ahead and feed you and put you up for the night, while I'm at it?
You heard him. Kill whoever's "messing with you." Or try, at least.
I took down a dozen contenders to get this post. I ain't even a little bit scared of you.
It's you! It's really you! I can hardly believe my optical circuits!
Jakarro and Deefour. I was hoping I hadn't seen the last of you.
It is good to see you, too, Sith!
Welcome to Rishi, my lord. Not exactly the paradise we'd hoped it would be....
The chumps who pass for pirates in this place are a joke! I like the bird ones, though.
It is good to see you, too, bounty hunter!
And may I thank you for not taking advantage of yet another bounty on our heads.
You could make some serious credits if any of the chumps who pass for pirates in this place have markers on them! Easy pickings!
It is good to see you, too, spy!
Oh, just broadcast it, why don't you! Big lug. Do you not know what "undercover" means?
I would not worry--the pirates here barely understand anything about anything!
I had a feeling Lana and Theron were talking about you when they said they had help. A bad feeling.
Always willing to put down others--I like you! The chumps who pass for pirates in this place, on the other hand....
Jakarro, I don't think I can take any more flapping out of that synthesized yap.
The droid keeps me from becoming too relaxed on this boring backwater. He stays on!
All bluster aside, this planet's inhabitants are not to be trifled with. The Nova Blades in particular are a powerful and organized group.
That is why we intend to depower and disorganize them by firing from Jakarro's ship on the targets of your choosing.
They see me causing trouble and word gets out that the Howling Tempest Gang is coming for the Nova Blades.
Precisely! It's nice to not have to explain everything for a change.
Watch it, droid!
If we're using a ship, we could take out their entire depot.
If you are to be implicated as the perpetrator of these acts, you must be seen flagging their assets.
If you miss, you make me look bad. Don't miss.
With your guidance, we couldn't possibly miss!
Here. The sooner we finish making a mark with the Nova Blades, the sooner we can get at the Revanites!
I'd wish you good luck if I thought you'd need it. We'll keep in touch!
You must be the one Lord Beniko and Agent Shan have brought to assist us!
Stop calling her Lord, droid! You know she hates that!
I'm showing respect, Jakarro. You could learn to do the same once in a while.
And you could learn to properly introduce us!
What? Oh--you are now in the presence of renowned illicit-transport specialist Jakarro. I am his translator, Ceetoo Deefour.
We are here under the direction of Lord--of Miss Beniko and Agent Shan--to assist you in your exciting campaign against the Nova Blades!
All right, then--what are we waiting for?
We have been waiting for you!
Jakarro says he is pleased to get things underway!
What are you, local pirates or something?
Do not compare me to the sorry pirates on this backwater dump!
Jakarro wishes me to convey that we do not, in fact, live here.
You have me confused with someone who needs assistance.
And you have me confused with a Wookiee who cares!
While Jakarro recognizes your obvious prowess, he would nevertheless prefer to lend a hand.
I understood every word he said.
Thank goodness! I hate having to reword his every foul utterance.
Watch it, droid! I can still drop what is left of you into an active volcano!
What Jakarro lacks in manners, he makes up for in heart, and he would very much like revenge on the Revanites, who hired and then betrayed him. As would I.
To that end, we plan to start by taking apart the Revanites' allies by firing from Jakarro's ship on the targets of your choosing.
At last! You should know by now that it isn't wise to keep the mighty Jakarro waiting!
Must you complain so loudly, master? There could be ruthless pirates or hungry wildlife all around us! Hearing us! Smelling us!
I'm glad to see you're still helping us out. We need all the allies we can get.
You've got that right.
You should watch out for cannibals, too. Apparently that's actually a problem around here.
Well, I think I'm safe on that account, at least. Hopefully.
I was sure that Theron and Lana would have gotten rid of you by now.
Ha! They would be long dead without my wisdom to guide them.
This is my life....
Theron and Lana got the little Jedi they were hoping for! Now we can finally get to work.
You must be the soldier. From all of Theron and Lana's talk, I thought you'd be taller at least.
At last, a star captain of some reputation! The rest of this planet's scum are amateurs at best.
Allow me to present my master, the noted transport specialist Jakarro! And I am Ceetoo-Deefour, former translator to her majesty, Queen--
Shut up, droid! Nobody cares about you.
We're pretty short on allies right now. I'll be glad to have your help.
You see, Jakarro? There are people with manners on this planet after all!
How did you two get mixed up in all of this?
The Revanites hired us for a job, then betrayed, tortured, and threatened to kill us!
Is that why you're... in pieces?
No, that was for speaking out of turn. Always.
I want to see the Revanites ruined as much as you and your other tiny friends do. Now can we get on with it?
You're an... interesting pair.
How kind of you!
Now, are we going to destroy these Revanite-loving scum-eaters, or are we going to stand out in the heat all day?
Theron and Lana said you'd have a plan?
Yes. You will mark targets in the supply cache. I will be circling in my ship nearby. When a target is marked, I will blast it to bits!
You mean... we don't have to go charging in face-first this time? We're staying in the ship? Oh, thank you master, thank you!
Quit blubbering, droid! Don't forget the rest!
Oh, yes... please make sure it's clear that this was the work of the Red Hulls. We need to keep up appearances, after all!
Very well. Let's get started.
Understood. Ready to move?
Sure thing. You two ready?
Yes! Good hunting!
Gotta love the pirate life....
Try again later, boss.
Pleasure doin' business with you.
Gettin' kinda popular with the local dregs....
Ren Moru and his crew are waitin' to hear your orders. What's it gonna be, boss?
Start with everything that isn't nailed down; then keep going.
Make sure everyone's tended to, and that they know who's responsible.
Look for anyone in need and lend them a hand. No charge.
Doin' good oughta help your standin' with the residents around here.
You're pirates. So pirate.
Better sew on some extra pockets; we'll be linin' all of 'em soon enough.
Check back later. Should have somethin' for you.
You're getting off this island.
I--wow, thank you! We'll hide out in one of them shipping deals till you're ready to go!
Thanks! You're alright!
About time I got outta here...!
Owe you one!
The nightmare's finally over!
Jakarro, I have a pickup for you.
Ceetoo Deefour here. We have your coordinates and are on our way.
Been mining exonium for the Blades every day for two years--all to pay off a lousy three grand I owed. And I ain't the only one.
Your debt's the least of the Nova Blades' worries right now.
I believe it.
You're free to do what you want now.
Yeah, and we had a talk about that.
Tell your sob story to someone who cares.
Ain't going after sympathy. Just letting you know none of us got any love for Margok and his crew.
Even in this place, we hear stuff. About your gang, the way you been making life ugly for the Blades. We wanna be a part of that.
You want to work for me?
Hey, we're good at a whole lotta stuff. Tell you what: get in touch with a pal of mine in Raider's Cove. Harlow Ricks.
Check in with Ricks from time to time, tell him what you want us to do, and we'll do it--simple as that.
You get nice and close to Margok, you give him one for me, all right?
Be wary, people of Raider's Cove--the Howling Tempest Gang has come to Rishi!
You will know true fear when you cast your eyes upon the Howling Tempest Gang!
The Republic can't touch the Howling Tempest Gang, and the Empire is afraid to even try!
Who has Kai Zykken so scared he won't even go outside? It's the Howling Tempest Gang!
The Howling Tempest Gang's a perilous pack of pirates whose prowess rivals that of the Nova Blades!
Look out, Raider's Cove! The Red Hulls are coming, and they've got an appetite for murder!
That's right, a pirate crew so vicious that they paint their ships with the blood of their victims! The Red Hulls!
Is it true that members of the Red Hulls actually eat their victims? Find out when they arrive on Rishi!
If you consider yourself easily startled or especially delicious, steer clear of the Red Hulls!
Have you heard the terrifying tale of the Red Hulls? What about you? Or you?
Greetings to you! Would you like to hear a true story about the legendary Howling Tempest Gang?
Oh--I beg your pardon! I didn't realize it was you! How exciting! Such a pleasure to make your acquaintance!
You should consider yourself honored and fortunate to have this opportunity.
Indeed, I do! My master did not prepare me for the sheer measure of awe I would be required to process!
What exactly is your purpose?
I've been assigned by my master to spread word of your many accomplishments throughout all of Raider's Cove!
Whoever put you up to all this lied to you. I'm not who you think.
I thought my master told me everything, but I had no idea you were so modest!
Why, in the time since your arrival, you have already defeated the illustrious Gorro, brought fear to the Corellian Run Scoundrels and Carida Corsairs....
Even the Nova Blades have taken notice of you! My master would be most impressed.
Arrange a meeting.
You're going to take me to your master--whether you'd like to or not.
I should like to confer with your master. You will arrange an introduction.
Don't suppose there's any chance of your master coming around to chat?
You know, I wouldn't mind a face-to-face with your master so I can get to the bottom of all this.
It just so happens that my master would like very much to see you, and has authorized me to direct you to a point of contact.
Why is that impressive? What's so special about the Nova Blades?
I'm afraid you would need to ask my master. Fortunately, I've been authorized to direct you to a rendezvous point so you can do just that.
I want to know who has you broadcasting these stories about me. Give me a name.
You may direct any and all questions to my master, as I have been authorized to arrange an introduction.
Oh--do be careful in your travels. Legend or no, Gorro's brother Grumm is severely displeased as to Gorro's fate.
Greetings, gentlebeing! Let me regale you with the tale of the dread Red Hulls, and their monstrous, flesh-eating captain!
Oh, my! You are the monstrous, flesh-eating captain of the Red Hulls! What a singular pleasure to meet you!
Who programmed you to say these things about me?
I'd be happy to tell you! They're eager to meet you, after all! Big fans!
You can find them at these coordinates. But do be careful! After your magnificent duel with Gorro, there may be others out for revenge!
Excuse me! You there! Have you heard of the dread Red Hulls, and their monstrous, flesh-eating captain?
I hear you're looking for me--or someone who fits my description, at least.
Kareena--would you explain that the two-time Supreme Hunter of the Goa-Ato is not intimidated by any Howling Tempest Gang scum?
Think you just did that yourself, Gorro.
Hang on--you're not about to wreck my place again, are you? I'm still filling in blaster holes!
You will have to clean up their blood, but that should be the extent of it.
I doubt it. This one will not put up much of a fight.
It is too bad. I was looking forward to a challenge.
No, this won't be a challenge at all. Not for me.
I like your style. It might have been fun to share a drink, but people are watching now, and I have a reputation to maintain.
Care to explain what this is all about?
Every time I eliminate a pirate legend, my rates go up. I like credits--and an audience to watch me work.
I don't belong to any Howling Tempest Gang.
So--you are afraid to fight me! I hope everyone here is hearing what a coward you turned out to be.
People of the Blaster's Path, watch and see just how easily the Howling Tempest Gang's best and brightest can be disposed of!
You may be seen as a hero on Rodia, but compared to me....
Maybe you're a big deal on Rodia, friend, but next to me...?
Last chance to back out before you've made a huge mistake, Gorro....
You have made the mistake--by coming here. Welcome to Rishi!
I'm done with you. [Attack]
You were amusing for a moment at best. Now die.
People of the Blaster's Path--feel free to stick around. This'll be over in a second.
Are you done talking? Can I go ahead and kill you now? Yes? Good.
It's the truth! They don't just kill the crews they rob, they cook them and eat them!
When I kill people, I have the decency to leave their corpses where they fall. These Red Hulls give us all a bad name!
You must be Gorro.
You! The captain of the Red Hulls, in the flesh!
Easy, Gorro... I just cleaned up after your last brawl. Don't do this to me again.
Are you kidding? I've killed traders, soldiers, thieves, even beasts... but never a cannibal. This will be fun.
Who told you that I'm the captain of the Red Hulls?
Everyone's heard of you. And once I've killed you, everyone will hear about me.
Fighting me won't prove anything. I am not this pirate you think I am.
Your aggression is blinding you. I am not the person you want to fight.
I'm not the one you're after, Gorro. I'm a soldier, not a pirate.
You want to get your name out there, I get it. But coming after me isn't going to do that for you.
Shut up!
I heard that all pirates are welcome here. You aren't exactly making me feel welcome.
You're going to stop telling people these lies about me. Now.
Fine. I'll tell them how I killed you instead!
I can see where this is headed....
The rumors were true! You're here! You're really here!
You know us?
You know me?
Oh, sure. I've heard you described in great detail. Great detail!
You run the Howling Tempest Gang! The most daring, ruthless pirates of the Gordian Reach--wherever that is!
I don't know what you think you've heard, but you're mistaken.
Nice try, but there's no mistaking the talk of the town!
You're a strange one. Can't say I've ever met an alien quite like you before....
I'm Rishii. You wouldn't have met anyone like us on any other planet. That's what everyone in town says, anyway.
That's right. What's it to you?
Just like a pirate! You're all so touchy. I love it. You'll fit right in here.
Seems like everyone in Raider's Cove is going on about you and all your insane adventures. Talk about your tough customers!
Your Basic, it's very natural.
My people pick up languages and stuff real easy. Some of us like to be formal. I'm more of a cantina-talk type.
Speaking of cantinas, you'll wanna watch for Gorro. He wants to fight you so bad it's not even funny!
What's a "Gorro"?
Rodian. With the eyes and ears and the snout? He's a supreme... something-or-other. I forget. Really tough for his size.
Wants to fight me? What did I do?
You'd have to ask him. Considering what a big deal you are, it's probably just for bragging rights.
Tell me where to find him. I'll see he gets what he's asking for.
Gorro's at the Blaster's Path. Local watering hole. Probably washing down some tonitran jerky with a Mantellian fungolager.
I'm not allowed in there anymore--long story--so I hope someone holos your big fight. I wouldn't wanna miss a single, bloody shot!
Oh... uh... hello! You're from the Red Hulls, aren't you?
Welcome to Raider's Cove! Nothing but fellow pirates here--you and your crew don't have to kill or maim or eat anyone! Right?
Kill or... what? Eat people? What are you talking about?
It's what you do, everyone knows! And it's no big deal! I'm sure those people your crew ate on Taloraan had it coming.
But we're all friends here, right? No need for any massacres or cannibalism here!
You've mistaken me for someone else. I'm a Jedi--a peacekeeper. Not a killer or... cannibal.
Do I look like some cannibal space pirate to you? I'm a soldier for the Republic. You're confusing me for someone else.
Whoa, whoa, whoa... take it easy, friend. Is this the face of some brutal killer or... person... eater?
I am a captain, but the rest you've got wrong.
You don't have to hide, everyone's heard of you. And no one is disgusted or terrified of what they've heard! Not at all!
Uh... except Gorro, I guess. He's been saying you'd show up, and that he'd love to take you on. But he doesn't speak for the rest of us!
Uh... as captain of the Red Hulls, I promise, no massacres or... cannibalism. Definitely no cannibalism.
Oh, that's a relief! After everything Gorro was saying about you, I mean....
He's the one who said you were coming. He won't shut up about it. Said he really wants to take you on--I'm sure he's just bluffing, though!
I might start doing one of those things if you don't give me some straight answers.
Oh no! No, no, that won't be necessary! I can tell you whatever you need to know!
Someone told you I was coming--told you all these stories about me. Who was it?
Uh... well... word's kind of been going around, but I heard it from Gorro. He told everyone that you were coming, even knew what you'd look like.
He said he was going to kill you as soon as he saw you. I'm sure he was just bluffing, though! You know?
Where can I find this "Gorro" person?
Uh... the cantina. Probably. He hangs out there a lot.
They serve good food there! No need to eat anyone!
I wanna see you fight Gorro--especially if someone gets tossed out a window. I love that!
Uh... have a nice day!
Kareena's charging three hundred for a holo of you taking it to Gorro. Three hundred! What a ripoff! Think I'll pay, though.
[Please note that by continuing this conversation, you are missing out on the Shadow of Revan Prelude.]
[The Prelude introduces you to new allies, sends you on exciting story missions, and includes a cutscene with companions aboard your ship.]
[Start Shadow of Revan Prelude]
[Continue this conversation]
Welcome to the Blaster's Path. She's all mine.
You know, a few blaster marks is one thing, gives the place some charm. But this....
If you heard Gorro before he died, you know I run the Howling Tempest Gang, and you know better than to cross me.
Someone is about to tell me how everyone on Rishi seems to know I was on my way here. Who will it be?
Listen up: I'm here on official Imperial business. Interference of any sort will be considered an act of sedition, punishable by death.
Now, with that in mind, who's ready to provide the name of anyone spreading lies about me?
[Address cantina as yourself]
Listen to me. I am the Emperor's Wrath. I am hate incarnate.
I want to know who is claiming I'm some imbecilic pirate, and I want to know now.
You see before you a Dark Councilor of the Sith Empire. I should demand that you kneel.
Instead, all I ask is that you give me the information I seek. Who is responsible for this ludicrous charade?
Alright, all you scum. You know who I am, and you know I can probably find a contract out on every last one of you.
Just point me to the joker behind all this "Howling Tempest" junk and I won't go claiming any bounties. Fair enough?
Everyone's talking about you. Couldn't tell you how it all got started, but I can tell you who gave Gorro the idea to come after you.
Don't do it, Kareena. You know what Margok would say about ratting out a resident.
If Margok ever pays the tab all you Nova Blades have run up, then maybe I'll start to care what he thinks.
Guy you want is Kai Zykken, leader of the Corellian Run Scoundrels. A real gem.
Gorro said Zykken owes you a pile of credits. He hired Gorro to take you out for a fraction of what it would cost to pay you.
Where do I find him?
Beats me. It's not like I hang out with the guy. Ask Zykken's crew--they're all over Raider's Cove. Like stink-flies.
Others might not appreciate your cooperation, but I do.
Figure it's either help out or have a bigger mess to clean up. I can handle the Nova Blades being sore with me.
Thanks for the tip. What are you doing later?
Cleaning up this mess, serving drinks, getting two seconds' sleep, then serving some more. Sweet for asking, though.
I'm going to assume you're telling the truth. If I have to come back here, it won't be pleasant for you.
As opposed to all the pleasantness of this visit, right? Hey, I told you what I know. Best I can do.
See ya, Gorro. Hope your brother doesn't decide this was my fault....
Ugh... this is the worst mess yet.
You... uh... you're not gonna eat him, are you? That's the last thing I need people hearing about my place.
Please listen to me: I am not a cannibal. I am not a pirate. I just came for information. I didn't want any of this to happen.
Yeah, well, Gorro did. When he sees... saw... a chance for blood, he always went for it. No talking him down.
The... uh... Red Hulls only eat people during raids. That's our code.
Uh... okay. Good to hear.
Do you know who told Gorro about me?
You are going to tell me exactly what I want to know. You won't use the words "cannibal" or "pirate" or any of that nonsense.
Who told Gorro about me? I want a name.
Kai Zykken. He's an idiot that runs one of the crews here in town.
Gorro had just come from one of Zykken's sabacc games when he started talking you up. Had to be him.
I don't let Zykken or his goons into my place--you'll have to find them out in town somewhere.
And watch out for Gorro's brother... he's a handful.
If you find Kai Zykken, do me a favor--don't bring him here, okay?
Theron? Are you getting this?
Loud and clear. I'm in. Full access.
This is the sort of momentum we could never create on our own.
We need to maintain that momentum. Surely, if the Revanites are done with the Nova Blades as Revan indicated, they're on to the next stage of their plan.
There'd better be something in the Nova Blades' files that sheds some light on what Revan's doing with those hyperspace routes.
Yeah, tell me about it. I'm starting to feel like flying blind is the new normal.
With Margok dead, there'll be a power vacuum on Raider's Cove.
Either the Nova Blades recover or another faction takes hold. I feel it's not our concern, really.
Lana's got a heart of stone sometimes, but yeah--let Raider's Cove worry about Raider's Cove.
I'm not worried.
Say all you like about Revan, he was never as powerful a Sith as I am now.
Revan's hardly the first Force user I've had to take down. It won't be a problem.
It's not just Revan here; it's all his coconspirators. We don't know how many in the Republic and Empire are pulling strings for him.
While Theron's pulling down data, I suggest you start to make your way back to Raider's Cove. Hopefully, he'll have found something of use by then.
I'm in. There are dozens of comm logs in here... hundreds. Sent to people all over the galaxy. Coruscant, Dromund Kaas, Corellia....
The names are all encoded, but breaking through that is only a matter of time. I'm going to get started right away. Great work.
You should hurry back. Despite what we overheard earlier, the Revanites could show up at any moment to try and help their allies.
Besides... I think we've earned a bit of a celebration.
I'll be back in no time.
I don't know that Jedi and Sith celebrate victory in quite the same way.
Well, now you'll have a chance to find out firsthand.
Copy that--heading home now.
See you soon.
And you said planning a party would be getting ahead of ourselves.
Do forgive my basic sense of caution.
Not a chance!
You'll never take the Nova Blades!
Got you on the ropes!
Run away while you still can!
Haha! C'mon!
Raider's Cove is mine!
Get off my ship!
You're making the biggest mistake ever. I got connections!
Come find me. I dare you!
This is my ship. Think you can just walk on in and be left alive?
Finally in. Nice work. Now to see where Margok's hiding all his secrets.
You. You dirty, no-good pirate scum.
Funny, that's what I was about to say.
Yeah, go ahead and laugh it up. Won't be laughing long.
This is it, Margok. The Nova Blades are finished, and so are you.
The Howling Tempest Gang was made up. Never existed. You're about to wish you were dealing with some random band of raiders.
We'll have to see about that.
My forebears founded Raider's Cove. This is my island, and I'm not giving it up.
So come on in. Do your worst. In the end, you ain't coming out alive.
So, you blew our cover, huh? Luckily, I can jam the Aggressor's external comms. About all I can do right now, though.
They've got live slicers in there managing network security on the fly. I can't do anything until they're offline.
I'll handle it.
I'm sure you will.
Good work.
You really are insane. Coming after us here? Should've stuck with picking on tourists in the Outer Rim.
You've sold your last slaves. The Nova Blades are finished.
We'll see.
The Red Hulls aren't even real, Margok. I'm here about your friends--the Revanites.
You know more than I would've thought. But you're not going to take our place in that deal, or any other.
I wouldn't have had to come here if you weren't too afraid to leave this old dump.
I have more important things to do than taking on every wanna-be outlaw that lands on Rishi.
The Nova Blades founded Raider's Cove. We've been here long before you, and we'll still be here long after.
Good job blowing our cover, there. Lucky for you, I've shut down his other comms, so he can't give Revan a heads-up.
I can get the doors open, but it looks like the Nova Blades have their own slicers on staff, so I can't get at any real data.
I'll take care of them.
Good luck.
Give me two weeks, oh-eight. You'll be running again in no time.
That's my droid. You've got my droid. He was... we were mapping unexplored space. Rishi was our resupply point.
Oh-eight? If I get the chance, I'll repair you.
Oh-eight? I am not receiving. Repeat, I am not receiving. Where are you?
Oh-eight, I know those dirtbags took you apart, but you're still transmitting. I hope you can hear this.
When the Nova Blades took him, I thought we'd lost years of work. Hundreds of star charts, inhabited planets... you want a copy, it's yours.
Remain in standby. Divert all extra power to data integrity. We spent two years mapping the Rishi Maze, and I'm not letting pirates take that away.
Log entry 208-A: Will continue monitoring. Might still be useful.
I'm... impressed. I'm Remilok. My employers specialize in data security. You ever need us, we're yours.
Log entry 207-B: Someone's observing me. Keep quiet.
Whatever data the Nova Blades keep secure, it can't be obtained from here. Need a specialist to interface with beams directly.
Log entry 206-D: Nova Blades have not obtained my position.
Processing. Full spectrum analysis. Negative. Log entry 207-A: The narrow beam transmitters cannot be tapped.
You got the data? You found what the Nova Blades were hiding?
I won't cause you trouble. Just making a holocall, here.
Look, I'm losing your signal, and I think someone's listening. Let's just hope the Nova Blades don't search the wreckage before we get those biosamples back.
Nova Blades shot down a friend's ship--just thought I'd take a peek.
Hey, I'm not looking for any trouble--are those my biosamples? We were smuggling those to a research buddy of mine.
Anything I can do for you, just say the word.
Make you a deal--I pay for those, his company gives you and your buddies first shot at whatever he's making. Agreed?
I've got a buyer all lined up, and he says they're just what his company needs.
No, I can't get any closer. Nova Blades shot the ship down--what makes you think they won't shoot me?
You're with the Red Hulls, right? Hear another gang's been challenging your rep.
That means a death marker's out on you. Might be worth getting out in front of it.
You're with the Howling Tempest Gang. right? Hear another crew's been challenging your rep.
No one's going to mess with the Red Hulls now.
No one's going to mess with the Howling Tempest Gang now.
The only thing you have in this world is the rep of your crew.
Word is you Red Hulls eat anyone in their way. If you don't live up to that kind of menace, you'll be on the outs here in Raider's Cove.
A crew like yours relies on reputation as much as blasters.
Can't let other gangs think they're better than the Howling Tempest Gang. Won't matter if it's true by then, 'cause everyone will believe it.
In Raider's Cove, it's all about the politics between crews. Don't forget.
There will be fine hunting this year. A world full of challenges.
From the depths of the Spawn Nebula, the Slayers Three have come! Our shamans declare Rishi this year's hunting grounds.
My kin and I have come to hunt. You are welcome to join us.
These trophies are magnificent! The shamans will hear your tale; you honor the hunt and the Slayers Three.
You are the mightier hunter. Have you spoken to my kin?
Join us and know victory! Strip this world's predators of their bloody hides, and we will revel in ceremonial splendor.
The hunt is now! The reaping begins!
Careful--I escaped, but they're hunting for me. Don't let them catch you, too.
Slavemaster Kendruh doesn't just hurt us. He keeps records on our families, says he'll track them down if we rebel.
You really want us to fight back, get to Kendruh first.
So Kendruh's dead? If that's his list of our families, you'll get all the help you need. No one on the fence, no one holding back.
We'll take every Nova Blade still standing, I swear it.
So far as I'm concerned, he has to die first, and his black book of secrets needs to be found. Otherwise, half the slaves in there won't fight back.
Who are you? Did you escape from the slavers?
You're blasted right--and soon as I can, I'm going back to fight. If you're going in first, listen up.
Blasted Nova Blades... I'm coming for you, you hear?
I gather you're no friend of the Nova Blades. Good. They took something that belonged to me.
Double-crossing swindlers... I know you can hear me, "Nova Blades!"
Who are you? Is that my--? We lifted that cargo from the wreck of the Sun Ranger! Old ship was a deathtrap.
I'll stay out of your way. Cargo's yours--I'm just glad to see the Nova Blades dead.
The Nova Blades betrayed me for it, but you... you can keep the good stuff. Seems my revenge's taken care of, and I've got enough enemies.
That take was ours! We salvaged that wreck together! I don't know where you've hidden my share, but I'm coming for it!
Blasted ceremonial hunts will kill us all.
I am Derrus, of the Slayers Three. Our shamans declared a hunt on this world, and my siblings... ah, idiots.
My prey is within the Nova Blades' territory, but I'm sick of broken bones and torn flesh--I'm not returning.
How many fools must die to these hunting rites?
Perfect trophies and a fine hunt. Better than I could accomplish--the honors of our world are yours.
My siblings, the others of the Slayers Three--you might like them more than I do.
Our law is that all may participate in the hunting rites. Find my prey, and I'll bathe in your reflected honor. The rewards are yours.
I would hunt with you again, when the day comes.
These are... fine trophies. I acknowledge your skill in the hunt.
The Slayers Three have been bested--the honors and glory of the Spawn Nebula are yours. A good game; until next year!
Hail to the hunters! Let the best seize victory in our rites.
Have you heard? The Slayers Three have come to this world from the Spawn Nebula to dominate these pathetic creatures.
You are a hunter--you are a living weapon! But we are the galaxy's greatest, and we seek competition.
It's a good hunt this year.
I've already beaten my brothers. Beat me, and the spoils of victory in our ceremony are yours!
My beasts, stolen by the Nova Blades! Lokaibus will not be pleased.
Our mightiest war-beasts were stolen from our menagerie ship. The Republic, supposed ally of the Hutt Cartel, does nothing.
My master is powerful. Bring his beasts back from the Nova Blades, and he will support your cause.
The war-beasts of Lokaibus the Hutt, returned from the hated Nova Blades! You have our appreciation.
Once again, you have my thanks. The Slavering Arenas would be piteously silent without our beasts.
In the name of Lokaibus, Most Grand Hutt and Keeper of the Slavering Arenas, I declare war upon the Nova Blades!
To any who can subdue and return our predators, Lokaibus will pledge his riches--and his allegiance.
Lokaibus reaffirms his loyalty to the beloved Republic, and extends his personal gratitude.
Lokaibus has long believed the Cartel's alliance with the Republic was an error. Now he is most certain.
May the Force be with you, sir.
Got the word. Colonel Mol is dead; one more war criminal the galaxy won't miss.
No good can come of the Revanites. Do what you need to--I'll keep them off your back.
If you see Colonel Mol, break his teeth for me.
Sir! Sergeant Edrinu Zaya, sir! I'm not the enemy--not anymore.
You need to know who's involved here. The Revanites will take anyone, even the Empire's worst butchers. Colonel Raygus Mol, the man who burned New Drev'starn, is here.
I'd kill him myself if I could get close. Whatever you need to stop these people, I'm in.
It all went wrong somewhere. Blast it.
Ready ground defenses. The enemy will be defeated.
The enemy is commandeering our defenses! Shut down the cannons--we have lost this battle.
Watch your target identification. Friendly fire incidents will not be tolerated.
Fellow servants of Revan, we are readying the anti-air cannons. If our attackers bring vessels to reinforce, we will be prepared.
Weapons running cold. Situation normal.
Transmitting firing codes now. All units into position. Do not fire unless ordered.
May the Force make us strong.
Emergency! Do not attempt speeder transport--the enemy is poised to intercept.
This is my final transmission on this frequency. We will see victory another day.
Rendezvous via speeder if you must exchange data. Our systems are compromised.
Sensitive intelligence should be exchanged in person only. Speeder access is hereby granted to all--use designated rendezvous points.
My brethren, sentries report enemy activity in the valley. Ready yourselves.
My brethren, be wary. The enemy has accessed our comm systems.
Exonium's no hollinium, but it's worth a few credits.
You were scanning for exonium deposits?
Stars... you could power an army with ore like that. Guess you've earned a share, whatever you need it for.
We're not here to fight--just taking mineral readings.
Unexplored territory means big risk, big reward jobs. Could be worse.
This isn't like those meteor mining jobs. These people will kill us for sure!
You want to walk away? You've seen the orbital scans. There could be enough exonium here to supply half the galaxy.
Or it could be a sensor glitch.
Won't know until we survey the place, will we?
We were. We were about to pull out. Are those the readings?
The codes worked. I suggest you leave.
When the way opens, I'll depart.
Those codes are all I can offer. I promise.
I've been working against the Revanites since I realized what they wanted. Take these codes--you can purge their databanks, ruin their systems.
This isn't right. It can't be right.
Then perhaps I've redeemed myself. It's been an honor--may we meet again on Dromund Kaas.
Please--in the name of the Emperor, stay your hand. I'm on your side.
If they kill me now--or if you do--I'll die a loyal man.
Appreciate the help. Good luck out there.
That's plenty. True Nova Blades are nobody's servants--and the Revanites are about to learn that.
You need firepower? Free the rest of us.
They've been keeping us as slaves, forcing us to repair their ships. You help us, I guarantee we'll help you.
Blasted cultists should've stayed in the Republic. Or the Empire. Whatever.
Why did the Revanites take you prisoner?
I was a Nova Blade. Not all of us thought siding with cultists was a grand idea.
...Then we are agreed. A truce for the time being.
Quite a significant occasion. I see you've begun without me.
We both felt time was of the essence, Wrath.
It would appear we've reached an accord, and without a council majority.
We both know time is too short for consultations and politics.
Tell me this means I just doubled my client base.
Not quite, hunter.
Well, isn't this interesting. Did I miss any especially lively topics?
In fact, we were just wrapping up.
Satele Shan, Grand Master of the Jedi Order. Your intervention allowed us to defend ourselves against the Revanite fleet. Many thousands owe their lives to your actions.
And the all-encompassing rot of the Order of Revan has been excised from our fleets. Now we turn to the matter of Revan himself.
My agent here has discovered that Revan's on the fourth moon of Yavin, where he believes the last spark of the Sith Emperor resides.
Revan intends to return the Emperor from the brink of death so he may finally be destroyed.
We must protect the Emperor.
I am his Wrath. I will not allow that to happen.
You know as well as I that he is not the being he once was.
The Emperor now hungers for the end of life itself. He would consume us all--starting with you.
The Sith Emperor may not be in command any longer, but he still is our Emperor.
Emperor's king of the Sith. Might as well be king of my credit accounts.
No, that would be me. You must understand something, hunter.
He may not be in the best of shape, but he is the Emperor. He'll need help.
You told her about the Emperor--that he isn't dead.
Yes, I did.
The Emperor is not the being he once was. He now hungers for the end of life itself. He would consume us all.
In resurrecting the Emperor, Revan believes he will succeed where others have failed. But the Emperor will prove far too powerful--for Revan, or anyone else.
Let him be destroyed.
The Emperor is no more. He should be destroyed.
You'll get no argument from me, Wrath.
I take no issue with the Emperor's demise. He no longer holds any power over us.
No offense, Marr, but it seems the Emperor's more trouble than he's worth. Maybe you should let Revan do the deed.
No offense taken. In fact, I would tend to agree.
The Emperor's no longer in command. If it's his time, then it's his time.
Agreed, but there's more to it than that.
The Emperor hungers. If restored, he would attempt to consume all life in the galaxy, and I am certain he would succeed.
No one--not Revan, not the Jedi, not you, not me--would be able to stop him.
Darth Marr and I will be leading a joint strike force on Yavin Four to put an end to Revan's plan. I hope you'll join us.
As do I. For the Empire. And for the galaxy.
That went surprisingly well, I think.
Yeah, it's nice to see the Empire and Republic can work together without stabbing each other in the back.
It was the right move, arranging for your capture. We've succeeded, haven't we?
Unbelievable. Where's the trust? Huh? Did it go wander off someplace, or was it never there to start with?
If you were in on the plan, the Revanites might have been able to see that.
What, you mean mind tricks and all that? I have implants. I'm protected.
I meant your performance. Admit it: you might have betrayed the truth.
It's... not impossible, okay? Let's just drop it.
With all that's going on around us, we have to be able to trust each other. You owe Theron an apology.
At the risk of seeming egotistical, I will not apologize for being right.
Do it.
Theron... I recognize that I betrayed your trust, and for that I am sorry.
It happened. It's over. It's in the past. Let it go.
Exactly! It is what I tell the droid all the time!
Oh, yes. It's virtually constant.
I say enough of this. We need to focus on the Revanites!
Isn't there... anything else you wanted first?
Yes, will that be all?
Theron, help Jakarro ready his ship for departure. Lana and I have unfinished business.
Yeah, sure. C'mon, Jakarro. Let's let them... do whatever.
Your cavalier phrasing does not appear to match your flustered demeanor, Agent Shan....
Don't have to tell me twice. C'mon, Jakarro.
Yes, let us go before I see anything I cannot unsee!
Lana, I think it's time Theron and I got to know each other a little better.
I see. Then I suppose I'll... make myself useful somewhere.
Great! You can help prep my ship! The droid's worthless!
I believe Miss Beniko was implying that-- I am not worthless! Not entirely....
Yes, of course. Jakarro and I will make ready for Yavin Four.
Good! Anywhere is better than Rishi!
But I thought I heard you say you were starting to like it here....
Shut up, droid!
Onward to Yavin Four.
If we do nothing, the Emperor will devour us all. That cannot be allowed.
I will stand with you to the very end, Lord Wrath.
We've lingered too long already. Time is short, and the fate of our Empire stands before us.
I am with you, Dark Lord--no matter what.
Right, what she said. But less... Sith-y.
I do hope we get to kill a lot more Revanites. Not as satisfying as when I'm fully assembled and can do it myself, but still. Dead Revanites.
That might be the most I have let the droid say out of turn!
I believe we're ready when you are, my lord.
What good are all the credits I've earned if no one's alive to watch me spend them? We need to stop Revan.
That's certainly one way of looking at it.
Hunter, you almost made me laugh out loud.
Now wouldn't that be a sight?
Have you ever heard a Tatooine Sand Person laugh? Terrifying! I love it.
Shut up, droid!
We're wasting valuable time. Revan's about to unwittingly destroy the galaxy, and I rather like living.
Good news: you've got a fellow spy, a Sith Lord and a dead-shot Wookiee who feel the same.
Yes, we're with you all the way, Commander.
I'm sorry, did I not merit a mention in your list, Theron?
Shut up, droid!
We're ready whenever you are.
To Yavin Four, then. Let's finish this.
I love it. She calls me "her agent," like it's sheer coincidence we have the same name.
Though it's not like Master Satele raised me, or like we do any mother-son stuff. Just an odd way to refer to your kid, you know?
Jedi are cold.
Even if Satele Shan had feelings for you, she would never reveal them. The Jedi stifle their emotions.
What do you expect? Jedi aren't exactly the sentimental types, and she's head Jedi.
Yeah, I hear you....
When we get to Yavin Four, you should say something.
Eh, maybe. I'm not really bothered by it so much as amused....
Get over it.
So your mother doesn't love you. My only question is: Why do I have to hear about it?
Oh, no--mommy doesn't love you. You're an adult, Theron. Try behaving like one.
Wow, okay. You're the one who wanted to get to know me....
If Master Zho ever told me I'd be putting my life story out there for a Sith Lord, I'd have called him crazy.
Must be losing my mind, opening up to the Empire's most infamous bounty hunter.
Conned a lot of Imperial agents with phony backstories over the years. Here I am telling you the straight-up truth.
I'm the enemy--at least, I will be again if we live through it all. Gotta say, though, I've enjoyed this while it's lasted.
It isn't over yet.
It has had its charm, hasn't it?
You could say that....
And they said if I ever kissed an Imp I'd spontaneously implode....
Maybe by the time we reach Yavin Four.
Not the most subtle hint, but yeah--we need to get going.
Enough of this. Let's focus.
Don't get all mushy on me, Theron. Time to go to work.
I've had all the socializing I can stomach, Theron. We have work to do.
Oh. Okay, sure. Let's get down to it.
I'll have Jakarro plot a route to Yavin Four. Who knows--maybe if we ask nice, Revan will stop.
Some truths, they linger more than others. Like how friendship isn't easy to come by. How trust is far more rare.
Theron trusted me, and I don't think he ever will again.
You took a smart risk that paid off. Nothing wrong with that.
I know you're right, but the sense of betrayal Theron must feel....
If he knew how painful this has been for you, he might.
That would mean letting my guard down. I don't think I could ever do that, not fully. Not with Theron.
Theron Shan is a Republic agent. He's not your friend.
I've tried not to think about it, but I know you're right.
When all this is over, if we survive, we'll be back to working at cross purposes. I know there's no other way.
It's like when we first met. I knew our fates were going to be intertwined completely.
I've tried to maintain my poise, deny my senses, but I can't. Not anymore.
You don't have to.
What are you trying to say, Lana?
It's true what they say: patience is its own reward.
We should go now.
Yes, absolutely.
You'll have to try harder.
Oh. Yes, my lord.
What you're feeling now--take it with you on the path ahead. Let your agony fuel you.
Oh. I see.
Make no mistake--we're facing an uphill battle. You need to stay focused and be ready.
That won't be a problem.
I'll make sure Theron and Jakarro are ready to head to Yavin Four. Every moment wasted is a moment in Revan's favor.
Find a communications terminal and activate it. I'll attempt to slice in remotely.
From what I can tell, you'll need a key card to get into the Revanite stronghold. I imagine they aren't easy to come by.
There've been reports of skirmishes in the area. I want you to stay alert for anything out of the ordinary.
Such as...?
By the stars! Be ready to fire on my mark...!
You should be more worried about the saboteurs Lord Ivress ordered to infiltrate your camp.
Nice try, but I don't buy it. Ivress wouldn't turn against the cause.
Old rivalries aren't so easy to shake. Imperials, Republic... you had to expect this sooner or later.
The mistrust has been nagging at the back of your mind the whole time you've been here, hasn't it?
Like I'd ever admit that to you... which I guess proves your point.
No need to be suspicious. Look into it; you'll see I'm telling you the truth.
I swear, if you're putting one over on me....
Ivress asked me to help him, but I'm looking after the greater good.
You're... a Revanite? I thought I would have been informed....
Go! Get everyone on the lookout for movement from the Imperials!
Ivress must be looking around for Theron Shan--to use him against you somehow.
What? No, he's well aware that Shan's in the valley stronghold. I'm going to have words with Ivress when this is all over, I'll tell you that.
Not gonna happen, pal, but thanks for being gullible.
You Republic types, you're far too trusting.
I'd recommend letting your blaster do the talking for you.
Yeah. Yeah, I just might do that.... Thanks for the warning.
No, not on your mark. On mine.
You... you've got Ivress's people! You've turned him against the cause?
Whatever you think you've accomplished, you won't stop Revan, I promise you.
If what you're hearing is true--if Lord Ivress is really dead--I need eyes-on confirmation. Go!
I can confirm it for you, Captain. I had my eyes on Ivress the moment he died.
By the stars!
No matter what happens to me, Revan's crusade goes on. You know that, don't you?
You're going to tell me where to find Revan. Sooner would be better than later, for your sake.
Laying waste to the Empire and Republic--what does Revan hope to accomplish?
Revan wants to reshape the galaxy; to save it. That comes at a cost most find too high to pay. Not me.
I'll tell you this much: they took your collaborator to a stronghold in a valley on this very island. I hope you chase after him. You won't survive.
That's all. I don't have the details of Revan's plan. Even if I did, I'd never tell you.
You're feeble. [Force choke]
You can barely hold your composure. I know you fear me.
Don't be brave. [Strike him]
This is no time for heroics, pal. Let it all out.
You can't hide your true face from me. Your quivering; your fear.
I.... I don't know where Revan is; not for sure. But there's a stronghold. In the valley. It's where they took Theron Shan.
I swear, it's the best information I have. And I can't ask up the chain; they'll only grow suspicious of me.
You're worthless. [Kill him]
You have far outlived your usefulness, Captain--if ever you were useful to begin with.
Without a price on your head, this is technically a waste of ammo, but I'll be doing the galaxy a favor.
Normally, a Republic traitor would be a valuable thing for the Empire. But there's really no value to you, is there?
Get out of here.
Leave--and do it now, before I have a change of mind.
Abandon your command. You won't be given another chance.
Hit the trail, Captain. Don't care where you go, but you ain't staying here.
You're relieved of duty, Captain. Be grateful I didn't retire you altogether.
I.... Okay. I'm leaving. I'm gone.
Lana--Theron's being held in a valley stronghold. Could be Revan is there as well.
I'll have Deefour see what the Rishii know about it. We'll work out a plan of attack once you've returned.
All right. You're here. You've got us.
What's it gonna be, Jedi? Did you come to spout your narrow-minded drivel, or do you have something more permanent in mind?
I'd rather avoid any more killing. Wouldn't you?
If you didn't want to hear my "drivel," you'd have opened fire already. You want to talk this through.
We don't have anything to talk about.
Your betrayal ends now.
The commander of Havoc Squad. Expert at executing traitors. That's what your mission here is all about, right?
This can go any way you want it to, Captain. I'd like to avoid any more bloodshed if I can.
If you wanted to stop the bloodshed, you'd be on our side.
There's no mission, Captain. I'm here on my own.
Then you're even crazier than I thought.
Good guess.
Who in blazes are you, anyway?
Let's just say I enjoy exercising the freedoms the Republic provides.
The Republic is nothing but a tapestry of lies. Revan has shown us that.
I figure smashing your giant conspiracy has got to be worth a fortune to the Republic. And I could really use a fortune.
Of course. A mercenary like you could never understand why people would fight for a purpose.
We've sworn to overthrow the governments who've kept the galaxy divided for so long. To end this war. How can you possibly justify standing in our way?
You're betraying the Republic--causing thousands of deaths--all on the word of a single madman.
