You're betraying your own people, and getting a lot of them killed in the process. Why? Because some crazy guy in a mask said to?
Revan sees through the lies! He knows how to save the galaxy!
From what? War? Revan's been fighting this war for centuries--he's obsessed with it.
The man you're following says he's going to save us all, but he's manipulating and killing quite a lot of us along the way.
This guy says he's going to save us all, but he's manipulating and killing an awful lot of people along the way.
Will there be anyone left to save when he's done?
I... I don't know.
What do you want from me? Huh? Why are you saying all of this?
I believe you want to do what's right. And if you go back to the Republic, you still can.
You're serious. Just like that, huh? After everything that's happened?
Why not?
Hah. This is crazy. All right. I can't speak for everyone but... I'll give the Republic one last shot.
We're with you, Cap!
Uh... thanks. For all this. And... good luck.
You can help me stop this madness before anyone else gets hurt.
There's another camp nearby. Help me break up their forces. The less support Revan has, the less damage he can do.
The former Imperials... you really are crazy.
Hah. You know what? I'm in. Anyone else?
We've got your back, Cap!
Be just like old times. You give us a signal, we'll charge in with everything we've got.
Glad to hear it.
Welcome back, Captain.
I didn't come here to have a discussion with you.
Me? I'm just passing through.
You'll... never... ugh....
...Would anyone like some refreshments? We have several fine beverages available!
No. Thank you. I'm fine.
All right. Off to a good start....
Master Satele. Thank you for coming.
Of course.
Do we have casualty reports from the fleet battle?
It was bad, but it could have been much worse.
What's with all the sour faces? Did somebody start a war or something?
Not helping....
The Revanite ships have all been scattered, captured, or destroyed. Their accomplices aboard our vessels are in chains.
You've found a threat--and given us the means to root it out. Separately. What do we have to discuss?
Revan is still alive, my lord. And his plans don't stop here.
The Emperor is not dead. Revan thinks he can fix that--but he's wrong, isn't he?
No one person--not even Revan--can truly destroy the Emperor.
I struck the Emperor down myself. I saw him die.
You destroyed his body. Even wounded his spirit... perhaps more than anyone before you. But that was not enough.
I sense fear in you, Marr. If your Emperor cannot be destroyed, why fear Revan?
I would welcome the Emperor's destruction. Revan's meddling will bring quite the opposite.
I don't care how much Force nonsense is involved--anybody can be killed.
The Emperor can be destroyed. But not by Revan.
Revan isn't exactly alone in this. We've stopped a lot of his followers, but who knows how many more he's got?
It doesn't matter. They will fail, and we will all suffer for it.
If Revan wants to kill the Emperor, why are we concerned?
Because he will fail. And his failure will have consequences for us all.
Of course you'd say he's indestructible.
I do not speak with pride or misplaced faith. I know the depths of the Emperor's true power--and the true ramifications of Revan's interference.
The Emperor's current state is... nebulous. Incorporeal. To strike at him, Revan will first have to return him to a physical form.
Which is exactly what the Emperor wants.
He will destroy Revan, then move on to the rest of us. In time, he will consume all life in the galaxy.
How do we prevent it? How do we stop Revan?
How is that possible?
When he last tried, it was through a ritual that I stopped. How could he possibly repeat it now?
I would rather not give him the opportunity to show us.
Every living thing in the entire galaxy? It doesn't seem possible.
The depths of the Emperor's power are as much a mystery to me as to you. But he is capable of it--I'm certain.
You knew that was his goal, and still followed him?
I only learned of his true plans recently. And I am no more interested in being fuel for his insanity than you are.
We have to stop this--intercept Revan before he can restore the Emperor's form.
The Emperor's hideaway is a secret, even to the Dark Council.
The fourth moon of Yavin. That's where we'll find Revan. He wanted me to join him there... never said I couldn't bring a few friends.
According to our data, he still has extensive forces at his disposal. We would stand a better chance of overcoming them together.
No matter what evidence I present, I doubt the Supreme Chancellor will agree to any kind of alliance or truce.
Neither will the Dark Council. But my ships and the soldiers aboard them are loyal to me.
I can convince my troops to maintain a truce. They've seen Revan's threat firsthand.
Then we meet on Yavin Four.
Next stop, Yavin Four.
Very well.
We can talk on the way to Yavin. I have some business to finish here.
Thank you for your help. All of you. This can't have been easy.
The conspiracy is finally exposed. We've been hiding our actions from our allies for so long... it's a relief to have everything in the open.
So we can talk about how you threw me to the wolves, now?
So that's why you stopped me!
I made a calculated strategic decision. And it worked, as we can all see now.
And if you'd talked to me about it, I would've volunteered. But you didn't even give me a choice!
We couldn't risk the Revanites knowing that your capture was a ploy. You had to be in the dark for the plan to work.
Theron had a right to know the danger he was going into, Lana. You should never have hidden the truth from him--or the rest of us.
The ends have clearly justified the means. Personal feelings are irrelevant next to that.
If the Revanites knew your capture was staged, they would've killed you, and we wouldn't have learned Revan's plan. Hiding the truth was probably the best option.
We've got exactly one professional spy in this group. I could have handled it.
I don't care what your excuse is, Sith. You lied to us. Do it again, and it will be the last time.
I will do whatever serves our goal best. Defeating Revan must outweigh all other concerns.
I think it's time we moved on. Yavin is a long way from here.
Agreed. Let's get moving.
It's been too long since we really talked, Theron. Can you stay for a while?
Of course.
Have a safe trip to Yavin!
Guess you'll think twice next time a spy asks you out for a "quick chat." Wouldn't want to go through all this again.
That seems like so long ago.
I guess from now on, you'll think twice about visiting strange planets on the edge of the galaxy. Wouldn't want to go through all this again.
We have been through a lot, haven't we?
To put it mildly.
Are you kidding? This is the most fun I've had in a long time.
I don't know if I'd go that far. But good company helps.
I could definitely imagine more relaxing ways to spend my time.
Me too. At least there was good company for the ride.
I may have mentioned this before, but I've never been much of a team player. Things usually go better for me when I'm on my own.
Relying on someone else has been interesting. I'm beginning to think I should've started a long time ago.
I'm sorry you couldn't become a Jedi, Theron. You would have been a great one.
Maybe so. Can't complain about the alternatives, though.
It's never too late to ditch the spy business and sign up for a real job.
I've borrowed a few uniforms over the years. Not my style.
If you ever get tired of that government salary, give me a call.
Will do.
The SIS is a big agency. How did you end up working by yourself?
I like to think they just couldn't keep up. The Director probably has a different opinion.
You relied on Lana, and look what that got you.
That's... not a bad point, but I was really thinking about you more than her.
Anyway, thanks. Working with you has made all this madness worthwhile.
Likewise. [Kiss him]
The feeling is mutual.
Glad we're on the same page.
Come on. Let's go see what Yavin has in store for us.
We're not done yet. Come on, let's get moving.
Hm. Yeah, I guess we'd better. I'll see you on Yavin.
Lana? Stay a moment. We should talk.
Of course.
Enjoy your trip to Yavin!
This is quite a mess I've made, isn't it? "The wicked Sith can't be trusted." Just the sentiment we need right now.
There's too much at stake to worry about people's feelings. You got us the information we need to stop Revan, that's all that matters.
I'm glad you agree.
I wouldn't be spending so much time around you if I couldn't stand a little bit of intrigue.
Makes sense.
It wasn't the right call. But you did it for the mission, not yourself. That's got to count for something.
I suppose.
The moments we've shared--the connection between us--it's very important to me. I would never want to lose your trust.
My strength flows from the passions I embrace. My service to the Empire... and you.
You're very important to me, Lana. Our time together has meant a lot.
But that won't matter in the long run, will it?
In that order?
I suppose I can't really expect you to put me ahead of your loyalty to the Empire.
I guess I can't be surprised you'd put the Empire first.
And there we are again.
You care about loyalty--about your allies--more than yourself. Those aren't the priorities of a Sith.
But they are the priorities of a loyal Imperial.
There are many kinds of strength, and many ways to find it within yourself. I can show you.
No matter how much you tried to teach me, I would never become anything other than a Sith.
You're loyal, caring, insightful... everything the Empire isn't. Why fight for them? The Republic would welcome you--I would welcome you.
I care because I want to save our Empire. Joining you would hardly achieve that.
I promise, I can be a lot more fun than conquering planets and slaughtering people. Why side with that, when you could side with me?
A part of me wishes I could.
This truce won't last forever. Even if we succeed, the war won't end. There's no future for us.
I'm not ready to give up.
Are you?
Hmm... not yet. But time is not our ally. We should hurry along.
You're right. No matter how we feel now... this will only end in pain for both of us.
No sense in belaboring the point. Let's just move on with our mission.
Since you can't trust anything I say, let's not waste the time, shall we?
I can stay and talk a while!
No you can't.
Some other time then! Enjoy your trip to Yavin!
I'll see you there.
Safe travels!
I... I suppose I had this coming. Do me... a favor....
Captain Milenec. If I'm to die, he should, too....
My people are looking into the Republic Revanites. We'll see if they truly intend to stab us in the back.
If you want us to help with Captain Milenec, we'll be there.
Be patient, Sergeant, but be ready. As soon as we have word from Revan, our work begins.
Lord Ivress, sir! There's.... It's....
The Emperor's Wrath? Here?
Dark Lord! How can this be...?
You? I would have heard if there was a bounty out on anyone here. That could only mean....
It's you. The Imperial ghost....
The lot of you--here? It's impossible, unless...!
We're found out. I suppose Darth Marr sent you to fight his battle for him. Seems his usual way.
No, better still: you learned about us and thought Marr could be in on it. You're here on your own. We have the upper hand.
When the Empire and the Republic come after you, do you really think it will end with the Revanites on top?
I fight for that in which I believe. Should I perish in service to Revan's goals, so be it.
You used to fight for something else you believed in. At least with the Empire you stood a chance of having your efforts matter.
You might think you're in a position of strength, but this very second your Republic "friends" are plotting to take you down.
Like me, they are resolute in their beliefs. They won't falter.
Meaning you don't even have a contingency plan in place. What if the sworn enemies camped right next to you decide to revert to type?
Not against me, you don't.
You've heard the stories, seen holos of my handiwork. This really what you want? Just say the word.
I want you to consider who you're speaking to; then decide whether you care to test your theory.
You're bluffing. Strike at us now, and you won't make it out of this camp alive.
I'll survive, and you'll be the first to go. Then the sergeant. You know I'm right.
If I may say, my lord, he does make a convincing argument.
She makes an excellent point, my lord.
It does seem we've been less than a step ahead for some time now. Opposition at our heels and in the shadows....
You'll get no further resistance from me. I can't vouch for every last Imperial Revanite, of course, but I can speak for those present.
Good enough.
A wise move, Ivress.
Smart thinking, Sith.
I'm going to send out a team to look into your claims about the Republic Revanites. Could be you're onto something.
We'll call my indiscretion a temporary lapse. My people will be at your disposal, should you seek out Captain Milenec and his Republic contingent.
What do you intend to do about the others?
Captain Milenec and his subordinates? I'll have my people look into your claims. You may well be right about them.
Captain Milenec's Republic contingent? Whatever your move, you'll have my fighters at your back. Ultimately, we are loyal to the Empire....
You're already a one-time traitor. I'm afraid I can only trust you to die.
Speak your name, Jedi. I like to know who I'm about to kill.
Speak your name, soldier. I like to know who I'm about to slaughter.
Tell me your name. I like to know who I'm about to kill.
Captain Milenec.
Don't be ridiculous. I know the man. He's--
Ah. Changing sides again, Captain? I always knew you were too weak to carry our fight to its end.
Insults make for hollow last words, Ivress.
It's over. There's no point in more fighting.
No. I suppose not.
We'll keep them under watch and hold down the camp. We can fake the security check-ins so no one notices, at least for a while.
Proceed, Captain.
Open fire, Captain.
Let's wrap this up, Cap.
All clear. We'll hold this position and fake check-ins from Ivress.
Also, we got something interesting out of one of the Sith's guards--here. Coordinates for the bunker where your pal Theron's being held.
Good work.
Thanks. Good luck to you.
Hmm. With all of the security alerts, I was expecting more.
Let's settle this, Jedi. Before any more time is wasted with your pointless interruption.
Do us all a favor and die quickly, soldier. You've wasted enough of our time as it is.
The trash from Raider's Cove doesn't usually tumble in so far.
We don't have to fight.
Enough blood has been spilled on Revan's account. We can stop that, if we work together.
I'm afraid I'm not interested.
I don't believe it's a waste of time to try and save lives. What about you? Do you still want more killing?
If that's what it takes.
This doesn't have to turn ugly. We don't have to try and kill each other, right?
Your friends in the Republic camp already tried to stop me. Every last one of them is dead now. Do you want that to happen here?
I think we know how to deal with problems a bit better than Milenec and his pitiful followers.
Milenec and his people are all dead. Do you want to join them? Or do you want to talk?
I think I'd prefer to kill you.
It is good to have you back!
Alright, take it easy. I'm not exactly a hundred percent, and you're not exactly gentle.
Oh, good! The team's back together again--all thanks to you for saving Theron, of course.
He's lucky I arrived when I did.
I'd hardly say that's.... You know what? Never mind.
He was practically out the door all on his own.
Modesty! I might be sick....
No one told you to talk, droid.
You are beginning to sound like me! A good sign.
Theron, you have the intelligence on this signal jammer. You start.
Right. The intelligence I gathered in the company of several interrogation probes while being held against my will.
Jammer's on a nearby island. You've probably seen it. Can't be sliced remotely, lots of Revanite zealots protecting it... the usual hopeless nightmare, basically.
Let them try to stop me.
It's important we shut this jammer down. I should have backup.
We may not be with you physically, but we do all have our roles to play.
Whether we agree to play them or not, apparently.
The way you two are behaving toward each other--I want to know what's going on.
It's nothing that can't wait.
Time's running short. You know what to do. It's what you always do: triumph.
...Attacking from the air is pointless. The anti-air defenses are much too thick.
The torture has rattled your brain! The mighty Jakarro is not afraid of a few cannons!
I'm afraid of them! Doesn't that count? What are our other options?
I think a surface attack is our only real shot at taking the jammer down.
Leave that to me.
Perfect. We'll arrange transportation for you.
You've got to move fast. The fleets are going to be dropping out of hyperspace any second now. The longer we take--agh!
...The longer we take, the more we lose.
You can count on me.
The Revanites have claimed too many lives as it is. We're going to end it, here and now.
Well... one step at a time....
We'll get the jammer shut down in time, Theron. Focus on your own recovery.
I wish I could.
We've got a lot of brave men and women on those ships. I'm not going to let them down.
They're lucky to get Havoc Squad watching out for them.
You know me, Theron. Losing is pretty much the only thing I'm bad at.
True enough.
You don't sound good, Theron. Shouldn't you be in a kolto tank instead of planning missions?
Probably. But there's no time.
If the Imperials are the ones taking most of the damage, maybe we should let this play out.
I don't think we have any way to guarantee that. Better to face them on our own terms than Revan's.
I need to finish slicing the last of these Nova Blade files. They have data on every ship with Revanite infiltrators aboard.
As soon as the jamming clears, we'll have to broadcast everything we've got to convince the fleets to cease fire and lock up the Revanites in their crews.
One last thing, since Lana stepped out. Watch your back. I'm starting to think my little visit to the Revanites might have been her idea.
You think she's working for the Revanites?
No. But I don't think she's putting all of her cards on the table, either. Just... stay alert, all right?
I won't let my guard down.
Good. Enough conspiracy talk--get out there and take that jammer down.
This isn't the time to start dividing ourselves with suspicion. We have to stay united.
Maybe you're right, I don't know. We can sort it all out after that jammer's down--good luck.
Don't worry about me. I never fell for that "friendly Sith" act in the first place.
I didn't think I had, either. Good luck out there.
We will stop Revan. We have to.
Let's show the Revanites the error of their ways.
I've never met a people quite like the Rishii. Pragmatic, accommodating, reasonable--if it wasn't for the climate, I'd consider staying.
I haven't had any problems with them--so far.
Always be at least a little guarded. Not the worst way to live, considering all the betrayal on display.
I could see making a home here.
Really. New seat of the Empire, maybe.
Can't say I'm surprised. Rishi suits you.
Really. Hardly a hub of galactic secrets, current circumstances aside.
As I mentioned earlier, I did acquire some information worth noting.
I'm sure we have more important things to discuss.
Yes, of course.
Rishii observations surrounding the Revanite stronghold fit what we know: they're holding powerful warships on standby, and they're well protected.
Revan actually intends to take on the Imperial and Republic fleets all at once.
It's audacious, to be sure.
I don't care who or what they have guarding that place. They won't stop me from getting to Revan.
That is the kind of self-assurance I like to hear!
I don't believe Miss Beniko was finished, Jakarro.
Did any of the Rishii see Theron?
No, all we know is what you were told: that he's been taken there.
We've been unable to reach the Imperial fleet nearing Rishi, but I can confirm from the Nova Blades' datalogs that Darth Marr's flagship is among them.
No time to waste.
The sooner I set upon the Revanites, the better.
Absolutely, my lord.
Guess I better get to cracking some Revanite heads.
That's the spirit! I do like bounty hunters.
The Revanites don't seem to be dawdling; neither should I.
Indeed, Commander.
Get to work on a solution for our connection issues. He needs to know what's coming.
I'm working to remap the interference patterns into a code that protocol droids on approaching ships should be able to decipher--if they're any good.
Last I checked, my pay doesn't come out of Darth Marr's private estate.
Let him fight his own battle.
I'm not Darth Marr's minion. His fate is his own to decide.
If Marr can't handle an ambush, he isn't fit for the Dark Council.
There's far more at stake here than the life of one Dark Councilor.
Fair enough, if that's how you feel; I merely thought you'd want to be fully informed.
Press on. Stall their ships if you can, and we'll do what we can from here to reach the fleet and lend support as needed.
This technical junk would be much easier with Theron around!
I'm no pushover, but you aren't joking! We do hope Agent Shan is recovered.
Yes--preferably alive.
Now go show the Revanites--and, fate willing, Revan himself--why you are not to be trifled with.
Please hurry. The fleets could arrive at any second.
Theron is counting on you.
You're back. The Rishii told us about some disturbances in the camps....
I dealt with them both. Theron is being held in another Revanite stronghold nearby--do we know anything about it?
The valley facility? We just learned about it ourselves. The Rishii tell us there are quite a few starships hidden in the vicinity.
Revan's fleet.
Precisely. And according to the Nova Blades' datalogs, his plan is moving swiftly--fleets from the Empire and the Republic are approaching as we speak.
These aren't just small patrol groups--both navies have gathered their most powerful warships. They're being overseen directly by Darth Marr and Satele Shan.
I've worked with Master Satele before. I could contact her with a warning--I'm sure she'd listen.
I've been attempting to send messages to both sides, but they aren't getting through. If we ever do raise them, I'll patch you through immediately!
Critical leaders for a critical battle. Revan's deception has been very effective.
Both factions must believe this could be a decisive engagement. They don't know the half of it.
I wouldn't normally turn down a VIP party, but this one's going to get even uglier than we thought.
We know the Revanite infiltration goes pretty high, but surely not those two?
I haven't gotten far enough into the Nova Blades' data to know either way. I agree with you, though--it seems highly unlikely.
So I might get a chance to take down the head of the Dark Council?
Exactly the sort of thinking that will let Revan outmaneuver us all....
This talk is pointless! We know where Theron is, we should go after him!
What do we know about the Revanite facility?
It seems to be their primary operating center on Rishi. Heavy security, with only one clear path of approach.
You'll have to attack straight on if we're to have any hope of rescuing Theron and stopping this fleet battle.
Then that's what I'll do.
We'll assist you any way that we can.
May the Force serve you well.
Good luck.
Disrupting those camps is our best option.
You're new.
Are you in charge here?
We don't really operate that way, but I can act as that sort of figure if you require it of me. How might I help?
My allies and I would like to stay here.
Do what you like. No Rishii will have an issue with your presence.
What do you call this place?
The village doesn't have a name. It's just where we Rishii live.
Rishii or otherwise, anyone living here chooses when and for how long of their own accord.
I'm taking over here. You can help by not getting in the way.
There really is nothing to take over in the village; no ownership or hierarchy. You're welcome to do as you will.
More bird people.
I suppose now that we've left Raider's Cove, you're going to start complaining about them instead of the pirates?
No--those pirates are still the worst!
You cleared the path well. And made a friend?
I am called Arankau.
The other inhabitants on this island--are you in contact with them? Do you know what they're up to?
If an individual Rishii chooses to get involved with others, that's that Rishii's choice. Otherwise, we tend to see no reason to inquire.
These other inhabitants, they have also kept to themselves. Strangely, their encampment appears to be segregated. One group looks like her. The other is less... intense.
Imperial and Republic traitors working side by side but still wary of one another.
If they have more of you in their roster, I might be joining the Revanites.
You flatter me.
If their Sith Lords are anywhere near as deadly as Lana, we're in deeper trouble than when we almost became fish food on Manaan!
No matter what they look like, they're as good as dead.
So--there's a camp for Imperial traitors and one for Republic Revanites. And they're not exactly friends.
This may provide an opportunity--either to exact atonement for their deception, or to employ a little deception of our own.
It's an opportunity to thin the ranks, is what it is.
Your zeal for making heads roll never ceases to surprise me, Deefour. Don't worry yourself; it may yet come to that.
I'll take a closer look at these Revanite camps.
And we'll attempt to establish a better grasp of their activities.
I hope we can establish where Agent Shan is being held.
As do I....
We Rishii would be grateful for your help around the village--if you choose to provide it, of course.
Savor your travels.
Greetings! We watched you fighting on the beach--the other offworlders were very unkind. We are much friendlier.
Have you come to trade? Do you need lodgings? Outsiders are always welcome here.
Thank you for the warm welcome. I'm surprised you're so open to outsiders.
We love outsiders. You all have such interesting things to say.
You seem a little too friendly to be believed.
We've been told our ways are strange, but we don't see why that should be so. Shouldn't everyone be kind to neighbors and guests?
My friends and I are going to be staying here a while. Do yourself a favor and stay out of our way.
If you say so. As long as you don't trouble our people, we'll be happy to leave you to your business.
This place is a dump! Intelligent creatures actually live here?
An entirely new offworlder! We've never encountered your language--please, speak more!
Oh, there's no need for that, I assure you. I can speak quite well for both of us! Allow me to introduce--
The second head speaks too! I assumed it was decorative, how fascinating!
You mentioned the other offworlders earlier--the ones who attacked me. What do you know about them?
We don't know much, I'm afraid--they usually avoid us. It seems a little rude, but we know that our ways are different.
They have some camps on the island. They wear different colors--dark in one, light in the other--but they all work together. Like you.
Revanites. Some from the Republic, some from the Empire.
I think you're right. I'm still going over the data Theron decoded from the Nova Blades--go to those camps and interfere any way you can.
We'll break up the Revanites' plans before they do any serious damage. I'm sure of it.
It may still be possible to turn them away from Revan's teachings--if so, I'll find a way.
Whatever works. Just don't take too long.
Sounds like a plan. I'll contact you once I've put a dent in their operations.
I've got this. All I need are some stilts and a giant Revan mask....
Please feel free to take a more direct approach as well.
Save the reading for later. It'd be nice to have you along for once.
I'd like to, but... I really don't think you'll need my help. My time is better spent here.
May the Force serve you well.
You do not command me, Sith.
I don't take orders from you, Sith.
I'm not one of your slaves. You don't tell me what to do.
Then stay here and waste time while our enemies move against us.
I thank you. The village thanks you.
Whatever hospitality we can give is yours.
The creature that preyed on Rishii is dead.
Oh! You bring most excellent news. Our fallen will glide on a warm breeze to their fate.
Thank you, outsider. Let us feast on the beast's remains, and prize your triumph today.
Go with our best wishes to your hunt.
Oh, for the days when I could rip apart a tonitran with my beak! But She Who Greedily Devours is yours, if you wish it.
If you do not, a hunting flock must be gathered... before our whole village becomes prey.
Yes... the leavings of the beast! I know the hunter's signs--it must be near.
We must locate the beast that hunts Rishii. It will leave a trail.
There have been sightings of a great beast--"She Who Greedily Devours." Now we know her ferocity outstrips our scouts and hunters.
With your eyes so close to the ground, will you seek the beast's spoor? She must be tracked for the sake of the village.
I found your scouts. They're dead.
That is terrible news. The fledglings will grieve the most. Yet for you and I, there is no time for grief.
Should you encounter our scouts, do let me know.
My outsider friend, perhaps you would like to trade? We have shared what we've seen with you; consider sharing your eyes with us.
What is it you're looking for?
Several of our scouts have not returned. We don't believe outsiders are involved, but we're puzzled nonetheless.
Our scouts are quick on their wings, sharp with their talons--delay is unusual. Kindly alert us if you encounter them?
Your company is appreciated and respected, as always.
Hello? Are you there?
Lana? What just happened?
I appear to have sliced through four layers of encryption to remotely deactivate the power core.
Just in the nick of time. Don't know if I could've managed that, even.
Theron. Good to know you're alive.
I heard everything--about the jammer, all of it. We need to regroup for an immediate attack.
Whatever happens... be proud of what we've accomplished up to now. See you soon.
Hello? Is everyone all right?
Lana? You shut down the self-destruct?
I'm beginning to get the hang of this slicing business.
I've created a monster.
You should hurry back. The Republic and Imperial fleets will be arriving very soon.
I'll return immediately.
Understood--moving out.
Wasn't planning on staying anyway.
I'll meet you there--need to grab a few things on the way out.
The plan remains intact....
You'll never stop Revan!
You will fall!
You've done it now...!
Not good enough!
You can't win!
We are everywhere!
You've interfered enough.
I should have known the Empire would send one of its lapdogs to try and find me. You should never have bothered.
I should have known the Empire's lapdogs would find their way to Rishi, try to seek me out. You're wasting your time.
What have you done with Theron?
Theron Shan's fate doesn't matter. Neither does yours. I'm changing the fate of the galaxy itself.
All I see is you trying to destroy everything.
If what you're doing is so great for the galaxy, why not work together?
I can't deny that we'd make powerful allies, but you didn't tear a path through Rishi and my Revanites to help me.
I get you've lost your mind.
I understand how you might see it that way from your narrow point of view.
I'm not waging some war with the Empire and Republic. I'm saving countless lives, and you keep getting in the way.
The only upside in your being here, really, is that you get to bear witness. My plan's too far along for you to stop it now.
Don't listen to him--it's not over yet!
Theron! There you are.
Figured I had a lot to tell you, so I broke out. Guess I could've saved myself the trouble.
[Flirt] I'd feared the worst.
I was so sure I'd never see you again.
Are you okay? Thought I lost you for good, there.
Yeah, sorry--almost made it out the front door when I saw you'd shown up to rescue me. Should've known you would.
What are you talking about?
Don't know how much Lana or Revan told you, but he's lured the Imperial and Republic command fleets to Rishi.
Revan wants to draw them into a fight, try to take out the leadership.
It'll barely be a fight. Revanites embedded on both sides are gonna sabotage shields, weapons--you name it--and we can't warn them.
Revan had the Nova Blades build him a signal jammer. No communications at all up in Rishi space. It'll be a bloodbath.
One call to Jakarro and no more signal jammer.
The Revanites have that thing protected. You send Jakarro out there and he and Deefour become part of the landscape.
Impressive plan.
As strategies go, you appear to have outdone yourself, Revan.
Have to hand it to you, Revan--you do know how to strategize.
Too bad you won't be around to see the results for yourself.
The next time I see you in person, you won't be pulling off any miraculous survival.
Actually, I doubt I'll ever see you again.
This place is coming down. Soon!
You could have joined me, Theron. Understandably, you're as tenacious as I ever was. Goodbye.
Another pointless attack.
Where's Theron?
He and I have had some interesting conversations. My own flesh and blood, completely blind to the sacrifices I've made.
I've struggled for centuries to preserve the galaxy. To protect future generations from the most destructive evil that's ever existed. How can none of you see this?
What evil?
You mean the Emperor, don't you? He's dead. I struck him down myself.
So I've heard.
Do you speak of the Sith? The Dark Side? The Jedi have defeated them many times. We don't need your ruthless manipulations.
You do. You just refuse to see it.
You aren't the one paying the price for the battle you're fighting. What could possibly justify the destruction you're causing?
I suppose I shouldn't expect a mere soldier to understand the bigger picture.
Care to translate that melodrama into some "normal people" talk?
You hide behind pointless chatter. Death will come for you, no matter how sarcastically you face it.
I will tear this place to the ground if I have to. Where is Theron?
Hm. Not far, it seems.
What I see is a single madman getting lots of people killed.
Then you are blind to the truth as well.
You're here! Come on, we have to go, now!
Escaped all on your own? I hoped I would have more time to make you see....
He's got a signal jammer that's blocking all starship communications in the Rishi system.
The fleets will come out of hyperspace practically on top of each other. No coordination, saboteurs in every crew--it'll be a massacre!
And at last, the board will be cleared of distractions.
Self-destruct sequence! Come on, we've gotta go!
Look out!
I'm starting to get the hang of slicing. Theron's influence, I suppose. Give me one second....
There. A holorecord of Theron under interrogation. Coordinates are coming your way.
And Revan?
No indication he's there... but no indication he isn't, either. I wouldn't let my guard down.
And... in. Theron's toys make all of this slicing much simpler than I'd imagined.
Can you find any hard data on his location?
Let's see... here we are. Recorded interrogation sessions. Coordinates are included--I'll forward them along.
What about Revan?
No information either way. I'd advise caution.
Ever want to hate your life, go to Hoth. There's good scores in all the wreckage, but nothing else to do there at all. So boring.
Trade you for Taris. Any second a pack of rakghouls might jump you and tear your throat out. Literally--any second. It's never dull there.
It's--it's also really cold on Hoth. Like, freezing.
I like your little friend there. He sure has taken an interest in me. How cute!
My monkey-lizard? Oh, he's just wondering what you must taste like.
No, no, I'm kidding, I'm kidding.
Oh. Oh, okay....
Yeah, he pretty much knows already.
Observation: This spaceport appears to be in dire need of maintenance. Stripped wires, spilled oil, and unsound construction may all be to our advantage.
I have seen many things, but never a black beach on a golden sea. This will be an excellent world for us.
Guess this is Rishi. I think I might've been here before--it was a long week, I was trashed for most of it, but that skyline looks familiar....
Warm sun on black sand. We've seen sights like this in the memories of the nest, but never with our own eyes. Thank you.
Welcome to Rishi. Gorgeous beaches, pirate hideouts, and over six hundred open bounties. Too bad the HoloNet signal's weak--otherwise, it's perfect.
Raider's Cove. Shoddy defenses. Lots of hiding spots. Pretty beach.
Spent a week on Rishi once. Nasty bunch, even for pirates. Did things I don't like to think about.
It's a beautiful planet for such an ugly spaceport. I wish we could do something about it--but that's not why we're here.
Smell that, my lord? That's the smell of low-quality blaster cartridges leaking tibanna gas. That's who we're dealing with on Rishi--very cheap, very violent people.
This may be the saddest, most run-down port I've ever seen. I've said that before, but you keep surprising me.
You know I like my beach resorts with character, but this particular character seems a little less "eccentric" and a little more "spice-addled." Welcome to Rishi.
Take a slice of Nar Shaddaa and drop it on the beach, and you've got Raider's Cove. Don't lean against anything--it might collapse.
So this is Rishi. Heard a little about it back on Hoth--pirates talked about it like it was some vacation hangout. Got to admit, the view's not bad.
Every planet we visit--I still feel a thrill when we land. Look at the ocean! Does this ever get old?
Viidu used to talk about retiring to Rishii. Never was sure if he was serious--always seemed he was a little scared of the place.
My father took me to Rishi once when I was a little girl. I was scared of the black sand, but by the end... it was a good trip.
"Raider's Cove." Name like that tells you something--the locals don't even bother to pretend they're not scum.
There's so little about Rishi in our databanks--it's all secondhand accounts from smugglers and raiders. People who go this far from civilization like their privacy.
Query: Why bother caging and feeding the prisoners instead of working them indefinitely? Surely their resale value cannot be high after much use.
To capture a prisoner is a great thing! A happy event to be celebrated with a feast! These Nova Blades have no joy or respect for victory.
Slaves--the cargo of the stupid and sadistic. Way too bulky and way more trouble than they're worth. Most of the time.
We don't know what the political answer is to slavery. But here and now, we can set these people free.
When I was a kid, I'd sometimes slice bounty boards and put bounties on slavers. I felt bad for not paying out, but slavers are jerks.
Slaving is like hunting mice. No challenge. No honor. Cruel to the mice. Shoot to kill.
There's good money in slaving, but it's a business I won't touch. If there's one thing you've taught me, Sith, it's that slaves can get mean.
Were you really a slave once? I just can't imagine you in one of these cages. I can't imagine you... helpless.
I believe there's a place for slavery in the galaxy--I won't deny that. But certain standards should be upheld. These men lack standards.
No jokes, no smart comments... every slaver here--every scumbag who treats people like property--has to die. We have to kill them.
Look at these people. We'll do what we can, but they need a good two, three months of physical and nutritional therapy to recover. Not even counting the psychological damage.
Every day we're out fighting the Empire is a day we could have been stopping slaver scumbags. Just another thing to hate the Sith for.
I know it's not why we're on Rishi, Jedi, but blast it... no innocent person deserves to be in a cage like that.
It's not the cruelty that surprises me. It's that this goes on, ignored, in so many corners of the galaxy. Let's help these people, if we can.
Ah, look at these people, Captain. Even outlaws need to have limits. Slaving goes way past respectable crime.
Someone in the Nova Blades must be very proud of enslaving instead of killing the people who refuse to pay protection. They probably think it's ethical. I don't.
Had a run-in with slavers second year out of training. I still can't forget the smell--unwashed, unfed people caged in their own dirt. Blast it all.
My family owned slaves. I don't want to admit how long it took me to realize that was wrong. Let's do this properly.
Analysis: Overloading the Nova Blades' ship reactor will likely not prove feasible. Unfortunate, as a full-scale meltdown would prove quite spectacular.
Look! Had a ship so large crashed on my homeworld, I would have brought my whole tribe to the stars. We would have won battles endless!
Look at that ship. Imagine being on the bridge when it went down. We have got to try that.
The hive-ship burrows into the heart of the world, bearing life and sickness in equal measure.
I've been doing some research. The Nova Blades used to let their members marry and raise kids--they had their own culture. Now it's mostly just killing.
Heavy defenses. Clean, though. Not used to frontal attacks. Let's go.
Had a friend or two in the Nova Blades. Better shooters and better flyers than I was. Don't mind killing them now--if we can pull it off.
I never thought a pirate crew could rival the White Maw. These guys may not be an army, but they've sure got the firepower of one.
"Project Meteorite" proposed ramming Imperial cruisers through Republic blockades and using them as staging grounds once they crashed. It seems the Nova Blades beat us to it.
"Nova Blades." "Nova Blades." If I ever start a pirate crew, I'm going to call them the "Star Stabbers."
Look, if you crashed your ship more than a decade ago and you're still living in the mess, it's time to grow up. Get an apartment and a housekeeper.
"Nova Blades," huh? Takes a lot of guts to name yourself after a fiery sword when you don't carry lightsabers. Guts, but not smarts.
That's a mean-looking ship, but looks are all it's got. Nova Blades have it jury-rigged to all get-out--we do this smart, we can take them on.
I should feel sorry for the Nova Blades--they're only pawns here. But the things they do for greed are hard to forgive.
Says something about the Nova Blades that they didn't join the White Maw or the Voidwolf. Says something about how much firepower they've got, too.
It doesn't matter how big or fast a pirate band grows--egos grow bigger and faster. The Nova Blades could use a lesson in humility.
One thing about fighting pirates: They keep you on your toes. No tactics, no discipline, and a lot of messy surprises.
I understand this used to be the bread-and-butter of the Republic Army: large-scale action against militarized pirates. Pity the tactical reports are all outdated.
Warning: I am not programmed with biological data for the Rishii, master. Should engagement prove necessary, my approach may seem grisly and inelegant.
Do not trust these creatures, Chief. Too big, talons endless. They will hunt us for sure, but I will wear their beaks with pride!
You'd think their feathers would be worth something, but... nah. If they were, someone would already be poaching 'em.
We could spend a year among the Rishii and still leave unsatisfied. What do they believe? How do they organize their families? What can the Empire learn from them?
You think the Rishii ever rent their homes to tourists? Tell me you don't want to come back next time we get a week off.
Rishii are predators. Good eyes. Sharp beaks. I'd like to meet a Rishii Mandalorian.
Wouldn't mind having wings, living in a place like this. Some people are born with all the luck, huh?
How do the Rishii stand having those pirates on their world? There's so much beauty here. Why don't they fight?
The Rishii could make fine allies for the Empire. Of the alien species we've recruited, few have natural aerial attack capacity.
Okay, I admit it--the Rishii terrify me. Just look at those beaks! I'm going to have nightmares about being snapped up and eaten.
You ever met a Mrlssi before? Talk about feathers... this one woman loved to have the down on her neck scratched. But I'm not saying try that with the Rishii.
I'm always nervous in places like this. I know the Rishii aren't exactly primitive, but they're not cosmopolitan either. One wrong word and they'll hate the Jedi forever.
Can't say I envy the job, but it's always a joy seeing you play goodwill ambassador to a new species. Let's hope these Rishii stay friendly.
Do you think there are Force-sensitives among the Rishii? I bet there are. I'd like to see a Rishii Jedi fly.
Say, Captain--think it would be wrong to take a feather as a souvenir? I won't pluck it off a Rishii or anything.
I didn't get to see the Rishii last time I was here. Not up close--but I saw one gliding, once. Glad to get a second chance.
Too bad there's not more time. Give me a month, I'd have these Rishii running a militia that would terrify the pirates. They're natural predators.
There's something admirable about the way the Rishii just ignore the outsiders on their world. There's a confidence about them.
Request: I have previously attempted to avoid "friendly fire" incidents, master--but as traditional politics do not apply here, I would like to deactivate that program.
All this because they think Revan is a great chief? But the great chief is hiding! He is not such a great chief.
Joining a cult is basically admitting you have no idea how to live. Fine with me, but don't shoot back when I come gunning for you.
These people have found a home, and it pains us to oppose them. But their belief is not justification for their acts.
You see this? Republic and Empire working together for a common delusion? This is why I don't believe in people.
Empire. Republic. Together but still separate. That's their weakness.
I know you appreciate a good cult, Sith, but these people seem deluded to me. Guess that's kind of the point.
I want to feel happy, seeing Republic and Empire working together. But it's all just a lie.
This is madness, my lord. This is not a convenient alliance or negotiated truce--these are Imperial and Republic soldiers who have forgotten the very reason they once fought.
I guess the good news is: the Empire and the Republic can get along! The bad news is we have to join a murder cult.
Never thought I'd wish people would quit working together and just fight, but--I wish these guys would quit working together and just fight.
How can this many people be so convinced that the Revanites are the real thing? There's got to be a way to make them see reason.
I almost don't want to look too close--I'm afraid of seeing people I served with in this place.
Beliefs, alliances--they can be so fickle sometimes. If you joined the Revanites, would I stay on the right path? I don't know.
Takes a strong man to bring the Republic and Empire together. Not a good man, but a strong one.
I know a thing or two about leaders. This sort of devotion looks good, but it can't be sustained--zealots break, die, or kill their own idols.
What bugs me most about the Revanites isn't that they're defectors--it's that they do it in secret. What Dorne did was brave. These guys and Tavus? Not so much.
The Imperials here would betray their nation for Revan's ideology, but not for true justice. I don't understand it.
Reflection: That particular cave is perfectly sized to hold a top level predator. If desired, I can list the possibilities in alphabetical order.
Look, Chief! That cave is large enough to house a Gorax! Maybe nothing on Rishi is as fierce as a Gorax, but we must always hope.
Something smells in that cave. My guess? A lot of dead big game hunters.
There is a scent here. It is old and powerful, and the nest grows restless at its memory. Be wary of that cave.
Doesn't that cave remind you of the one on Dromund Kaas? The one where you killed "the Beast in the Darkness"? Let's not go in.
Cave's inhabited. Scratch marks, scent, spoor. Big prey. Good hunt. Your call.
Bet you could hide a lot of things in that cave. Guns, cash, maybe even a ship. Given it's Rishi, someone must have tried.
You sense that? There's danger here. Look at that cave. Should we... you know. Do what Jedi and Sith do best?
Note the cave entrance, my lord. Easily large enough to admit a terentatek or similar predator--if Rishi has anything of the sort.
Do you hear breathing coming from that cave? Cave-sized breathing? Let's not get any closer.
Hey--I may not have Jedi senses, but even I know that cave looks bad. Not "interesting bad," either, but just "bad-bad."
They never tell you when you're a Padawan to avoid big, dangerous-looking caves. Guess that's something every Jedi learns on her own.
Check that cave. If Qyzen were here, he'd be molting at the chance to go in. Me, I'm not keeping score.
That cave houses a predator--you can see the marks in the stone. They're beautiful in their way.
Mark that cave on your map for me, will you, Captain? I'd love to come back here one day, make a camp and go exploring.
How big do you figure the predators get on Rishi? I only ask because that's a very big cave....
That cave's a good hiding spot. Problem is, I bet something's already using it.
I think we should avoid that cave, sir. Unnecessary elimination of native predatory species is discouraged by the Unaligned Worlds Protocol Handbook.
Lamentation: The Order of Revan has clearly not understood the secret of Revan's success--proper application of adaptable hunter-killer units.
Sometimes I think of claiming a new ship. But if I take the ship of an enemy, he must be truly great. These ships are not enough for me.
An army of drooling morons and enough blaster stockpiles to keep us shooting for days. You remembered my birthday!
There is beauty in a swarm of ships rising and dancing in the air. Considerably less so when the pilots wish us dead.
Great. So we're not just fighting an army--we're fighting an armada. If you don't ask for a bonus, I will.
Enough ships to wage war. One way to win: stop them on the ground.
Look at those ships. Wouldn't mind having a fleet like that. Don't much want to fight one, though.
Scores of ships and ten times as many cultists. I'm ready for this if you are, my lord.
At a glance, these ships have enough firepower to breach Rishi's crust. They cannot be allowed offworld.
Apparently we could have just landed here. Everyone else did. They wouldn't notice one more, right?
Will you look at those ships? Good news is, if the Revanites decide to pack up and go home, we won't have to give them a ride.
Wow! I know those ships are going to kill everyone we care about, but--wow! If we save the galaxy, can we go joyriding?
Wouldn't mind having an army to back us up on this one. Lots of ships and lots of troops ahead. At least tell me the Force is with us?
I want to lift up those ships and toss them into the sea--then we wouldn't have to fight this battle. But no one's that strong in the Force.
Those are some good-looking ships out there. I know we've got work to do, but I bet we could strip a few parts quick enough...
Always wanted to get my hands on a fleet. Tuning one ship is a joy--synchronizing a hundred sounds like a challenge.
Haven't seen a fleet on the ground like that since Corellia. That many ships could put up a fight against any planet's defenses.
I'll try to record as many images of these ships as I can, sir--even if we win, Republic authorities will want a record of any that escape.
Don't know how much longer I can come by. The vibe around your village.... I'm not feeling too welcome, and trust me, I know from unwelcome.
Oh! But it's everyone's village, not just ours. You are always welcome!
No, not the village itself, but... you know, the others. Each time I come back the daggers in their eyes get bigger, know what I'm saying?
I think so... but they have not bothered us any.
Well, count your blessings. Whoever these characters are, they're about as serious as it gets....
You're dead meat!
Let's see what you're made of!
Better start running!
So, I guess this is goodbye.
I suppose so. It's been... an experience, Theron. Be well to yourself.
Yeah. Yeah, you too, Lana. Try not to get into too much trouble, all right?
We'll speak soon.
She's something, that Lana. One to watch--or maybe watch out for.
She's done what's required of her. In fact, I'd say she's gone above and beyond.
Fair enough. You'd know better than me what makes a good Sith.
Yeah, that's one way to put it.
She is a slippery one.
Just... be careful.
I don't want to talk about her.
Hey, we don't have to.
What a ride, huh? If you'd told me when we met all the ups and downs we'd go through together, I'd have called you crazy.
Maybe I called you crazy anyway. I don't remember anymore. Between all my family fun with Revan and the Grand Master, and then, well, you....
You and Revan are related.
Centuries removed, but yeah, I'm his direct descendant. Made that interrogation the most awkward reunion ever.
How is it between you and Satele? Any better?
This is the most time we've ever spent together, so it's hard to say. I think she's warming up to me in her own Jedi way.
Care to finish that thought?
I won't lie. You've been one of the two real bright spots in all this.
Well, look, there isn't any easy way to say this, but... I mean, we both knew this would have to end eventually....
The Republic exonerated me, so I'm back in the fold. And they gave me a new job. A big one.
I guess I can see where this is leading.
That's quite a vote of confidence. You deserve it.
Okay, that's... unexpected. You do know what this means, right?
And here I thought I might be able to recruit you into the Empire.
Oh, yeah, why not? I'm sure everyone would trust me and never assume I was secretly working for my own mother.
Soon as we rejoin the fleet and make the jump to lightspeed, that's it. No more truce. You and I, we probably won't exchange another word ever again.
Who needs words?
You're my enemy now. Go.
Leave--before I regain my senses and strike you down.
Get out of here. Count yourself lucky that you're doing it in one piece.
Just like that. Why am I not surprised?
Watch yourself.
Looks like you're finally getting rid of me. How's it feel?
All things considered, we accomplished a lot working together.
We did, didn't we? Yeah.
I have to admit I'm going to miss you, Theron.
Same here. Guess if we ever meet again, it won't be friendly.
Well. Seems weird to wish you good luck, so...
See you, Wrath. Don't let the Emperor get you down.
Give my regards to the Dark Council.
You take it easy, bounty hunter.
Later, Commander. See you in the ops reports.
Just leave.
You...! I don't know why I expected you to be civil.
Have a great life there, Emperor's Wrath--right up to when you become your master's food.
Say "hey" to the Dark Council for me next time you have one of your little meetings.
Have fun with that whole "indiscriminately destroying lives for money" thing.
Might want to keep to the shadows, Commander. I'll be watching for you.
And then there were two.
And then there were two.
It's a wonder we're even here, considering all we've had to endure. When I was advisor to Darth Arkous, I would never have imagined any of this.
You've come far.
All you've done, you're at least due a medal--or whatever the Sith equivalent is.
Yes, about that....
Your service to the Empire won't be overlooked.
No, it won't. It hasn't.
If I didn't know any better, I'd think you were feeling a bit sentimental.
It's true; you've caught me. I do tend to get wistful when change is afoot.
That was before you met me. It turns out we make a good team.
Yes, we've managed very well together up to now. Even turned some heads, it appears.
Darth Marr has taken notice of my accomplishments. It would seem he has plans for my future. What those plans look like, I can't say.
What's clear is I'll need to reestablish order in my life. That means doing away with any... intricate entanglements.
Nothing lasts forever, does it?
How true.
It's good to see you getting some much-deserved praise.
I wouldn't have received it, if not for you.
Come on--that's overkill.
Please don't make this any more difficult than it already is.
You've been close to me like no other. Whatever may come to pass between us, don't ever forget that.
If this is our last moment, let's make it one to remember.
You should report to Darth Marr.
I.... Yes, I'll do that.
Darth Marr wishes to speak with me. Probably to remind me that we failed to keep the Emperor at bay.
I'll see you soon.
Next time you've got a fight that juicy, you know how to reach me.
Good luck, you two.
Going somewhere?
We're headed back to Rishi!
Jakarro, I thought you hated that place.
I do! That is why I must return!
Jakarro wishes to whip those sorry Raider's Cove pirates into shape! He sees a real opportunity there.
You'll have your work cut out for you. As invaluable as you've been helping us, I'm not too worried.
If you say so!
Jakarro thanks you for your kind words.
You should stay.
Stick around. The Empire could always use some muscle for hire.
You know you could be a valuable asset to the Empire, don't you?
Jakarro is his own Wookiee!
Beside which, we do have numerous Imperial markers out on us throughout the galaxy. Myself more than the lug, but there it is all the same.
What about you? See any of this "opportunity"?
Oh my word, no! But it should be fun to watch, if nothing else.
We have to stop by Kashyyyk first!
What? Oh--you know I hate it there! That's why we're going, isn't it? Just to torture me!
Shut up, droid!
Darth Marr. You wanted a word?
We suffered many casualties upon the Emperor's return, though nothing insurmountable. Nothing compared to what we would have endured had the Revanites been successful.
You are to be commended, of course--but it was Lana Beniko's guile and intellect that made your participation at all possible.
That is why I have placed Lana in charge of Sith Intelligence.
A brilliant move.
Gotta say, I'm surprised you're sharing any of this with me, Marr.
I should have a say.
This isn't your decision alone, Marr. You'll have to wait for my opinion on the matter.
The decision was made by the Dark Council. It is binding.
I have discussed it with the rest of the Dark Council. No one else objected.
I see.
Give us a moment.
Yes, my lord.
Don't you think it would have been be wise to consult with me first?
The two of you accomplished a great deal by working together. I don't expect that to change.
[Lie] A brilliant move.
I can't think of a better choice.
Thank you, my lord.
You're too kind, hunter.
Commander--coming from you, that's quite a compliment. I only hope I'll do my predecessors justice.
That will be all for now.
Now that she's away: what do you really think?
Lana's deceitful. I've seen it myself. Without knowing her true motivations, she could be a threat.
If she was purely forthright, I wouldn't have installed her. And let's not forget she risked everything to save the Empire from the Revanites. I'm not concerned.
She's inexperienced.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but Lana isn't trained for intelligence work, is she?
Acting as advisor to Darth Arkous does not qualify her for head of intelligence.
As I'm sure you've witnessed, she has a natural talent. And she's competent in handling all manner of assets.
I should be running intelligence; not her.
The entire point of Sith Intelligence is for it to be overseen by the Sith.
She's unconventional.
Lana refuses to even take a title. This doesn't concern you?
It says to me she's unambitious. I welcome the novelty.
I've met my share of Sith--yourself included--and Lana's nothing like any of them. Doesn't that worry you?
I'm confident her more unusual traits will prove to be assets.
That said, I appreciate your candor. It's important that we speak openly.
The Empire grows ever stronger. The mining of isotope-5 has bolstered our energy independence, and we're free from concern over the threat of Revan and his followers.
That's only part of the story.
Yes. Our momentary truce is over. We remain at war with an emboldened Republic, and we still have countless enemies, both seen and unseen.
I won't pretend to know how the Emperor's transformation has affected you. Enlighten me.
When the time comes, I will confront the Emperor and he will answer to me.
Bold. Unflinching. Good.
It's a lot to process.
Let us hope you find clarity before it is too late.
That's between myself and the Emperor, Marr.
I thought as much. But the moment will come when your allegiance must be made fully clear.
You are of singular importance to our future. The Emperor may have abandoned you, but in my eyes you are ever the Empire's Wrath.
Political deceit is to be expected, but we have had a full-blown traitor in our midst. Darth Arkous has fostered a new level of mistrust among us.
You sought to destroy the Revanites. Of all the Dark Council, the only one I can genuinely trust is you, Darth Nox.
I have often respected your judgment, Darth Occlus. Now you are the only Councilor I can genuinely trust.
You serve the Empire in your own way, Darth Imperius, but you are the only Councilor I can trust to be truly in service to the Empire.
I am the only one you need to trust. The rest can be kept in check.
That is kind of you to say, Darth Marr.
It is not idle flattery. It is a fact--one that should give you pause.
You and I are all that stand between one another and the throne.
And look at what the throne has done for the Emperor. This way is better.
For some time now, you have held a unique position within the Empire; that is to say, you are not from within the Empire.
What's your point?
Shae Vizla acts on whims, whereas you embody true Mandalorian honor. Your partnership remains highly valuable to us.
You continue to stand with us like none other, bounty hunter. You will be rewarded for your loyalty.
Going forward, when you work for us, it will be as one of us. You will have full Imperial authority and may act as you deem necessary without repercussions.
I can work with that.
So I get a license to do whatever I want?
Not quite, though the limits are few. You will not be punished for the murder of Darth Arkous, for example.
Not quite, though the limits are few. Had you been involved in the execution of the traitor Darth Arkous, for example, you would not be punished.
I get enough flak as it is, all the work I do for you. I'm not wearing your insignia, and I'm not going exclusive.
You may keep your autonomy. Just know that when you are not working for us, you are on your own.
The appointment of Lana Beniko might suggest you aren't valued, but nothing could be further from the truth.
Under Sith Intelligence, you will continue to experience the autonomy you have enjoyed since Imperial Intelligence disbanded.
I see no reason that wouldn't work--at least for the time being.
Good, then we are agreed.
There was never any question that's how it was going to be. I do as I please.
That you do, Commander.
So anytime Lana comes to me with orders, I can tell her where to go.
Lana will represent the Dark Council. I expect her to be afforded the same respect given to me.
I want full clearance, and either you or Lana will keep me apprised on a regular basis.
We both know you would slice into our datastores anyway. I have nothing to hide from you.
The Empire is whole once more. It grows and strengthens. Our obstacles are severe, but they are known to us.
The galaxy is ours to grasp. Let us reach.
Come in. Come in. Do you read me?
Legate. Secure on my end. You?
We're clear.
Been a while, Legate. You know, I've heard some unusually wild chatter going around lately.
Yes, I'm sure you have, Ardun. Why don't I fill you in...?
Revan's time has come.
Such a terrible power... this device must be destroyed.
It's hard to believe that Revan's forces could defeat even the Imperial Guard so easily.
I'm glad we can count on you.
This world... everything is flooded with the dark side.
The Emperor's return is troubling... but we still achieved a great deal.
We will put an end to Revan's plan.
You've been busy. So have we.
As we speak, our forces are working with the Republic to finish what you've started by securing the temple and ending the Revanite threat.
Finally, there can be trust between us--and not a moment too soon.
As we speak, our forces are working with the Republic to end the Revanite threat and take the temple.
In spite of our obvious differences--and the fact we're at war--you were able to inspire a sort of cooperation I never imagined possible.
Credit where it's due: you succeeded where Darth Marr and I failed.
But we aren't finished yet. There is one element even our combined militaries will be unable to stop.
Given his failure, he'll try to escape, to regroup. That cannot be allowed to happen.
Consider it taken care of.
He will be fed. He will! Be! Fed!
He's raving mad, but he still has information we need to breach the temple and prevent the Emperor's return.
I would like to interview him personally. Someone in his state must be handled delicately.
Time is of the essence. A more hands-on approach is required.
Yes, niceties are at best a luxury.
Right, we need to speak to him in a language he can understand: pain.
Take him to my chambers.
I won't forget this, Marr.
No, I wouldn't expect you to.
Violence won't work.
Whether or not he's insane, Iven finds dignity in serving the Emperor. If he's going to talk, he'll need to feel respected.
Given your unique perspective, I will defer to you, Wrath.
As you said, Marr, he's mad. And he's a devoted fanatic. He would only become more wildly defiant under duress.
Your counsel is appreciated. And you do make a compelling point.
Can't beat away the crazy, Marr. Trust me on that.
I will take your word for it, hunter.
He's fanatical. Unpredictable. Someone like that needs to be tricked into talking, not beaten.
I can always look to you for a particularly skewed perspective.
Bring the man to my chambers.
Just remember where the bulk of your credits come from.
It should please you to know your service to the Empire is invaluable.
What's the word?
The word? How about "unsettling"?
According to Iven, there's a device inside the temple they had hoped to use to bring the Emperor back.
It's a weapon designed to eradicate all living things on the moon, save for those safely inside the temple.
Oh, I should like to see that! Just imagine!
Deefour. Button it.
The device appears to be Sith in origin. That's how the Emperor knew about it; why he chose to retreat to Yavin Four.
Iven's team was going to activate the device; use the loss of life to restore the Emperor.
Yes. And now Revan plans to use it for the same purpose. If we can't stop him, we're all dead.
This is about more than revenge now! This is survival!
Then let's get moving.
Iven clued us in on a series of complex locks that will get us access to the temple. They're our next objective.
Theron, Jakarro... Would you mind? We won't be a moment.
Oh, sure, don't ask Ceetwo Deefour!
Shut up, droid!
Our lives have been on the line before, but this is different somehow. It feels more immediate. More... final.
So get that temple opened up and do whatever you have to to end this.
I've got this.
There will be no stopping me.
I'll see to it. You can be certain of that.
Hey--it's me.
Come on, now--look who you're talking to.
Good. That's exactly what I want to hear.
I've never seen you like this before.
That's because I have more to fight for now.
Don't fall apart on me.
I won't. I promise.
I'll be here. May the Force serve you well.
Hey, could you guys give us a sec?
Of course. Don't be long.
My line of work, you stare death in the face pretty much all the time. I'm sure you do, too.
I'm not in tune with the Force at all, but I don't have to be to feel it: if we can't stop the Revanites, that's over. Everything.
I'm strong enough in the Force for both of us. Revan and his misguided followers don't stand a chance.
I don't need the Force to take down Revan and his cult--which is exactly what I'm going to do.
Now that's what I like to hear.
So much for you following in your mother's footsteps and becoming a Jedi. Or even a Sith, for that matter.
A Sith. Right. And I could be your apprentice. I may be into you, but I'm not that into you.
Sure, and I suppose if I became a Darth I could tell you what to do. Yeah, I don't see that happening.
You know, I think I needed that. Better yet, I think you know I needed that.
You'd better not sit here and mope about it.
No, not at all. Guess I just wanted to say I hope you beat the snot out of every last Revanite out there.
Try not to die, okay? It'd be nice to see you again.
You'll be wading into Massassi territory. Be fearless.
We've got a much better picture now of what's between us and the temple.
First thing's the Massassi. We knew we'd be facing a lot, but now we know it's a lot-a lot.
There can be no reasoning or bargaining with the Massassi. Once we encroach upon their territory, they will attack.
That was the first thing....
The best of the Imperial Guard are trained in special facilities--honed to physical perfection and instilled with unwavering loyalty.
We found one such facility between us and the temple. The Emperor must have had it constructed in secret.
And there are life forms inside. Human. Whether it's Revanites or the Emperor's guard, they won't be looking to help us.
I'll find out who we're dealing with.
I can be... persuasive.
Bringing the willful in line is one of my specialties. Leave them to me.
Couple minutes alone with me and they'll be bending every which way to help.
I'll get you all the cooperation you need. All it takes is the right motivation.
I will not condone what you're suggesting.
And what do you think your agent does in the Republic's name?
Go look into it, Satele.
You could venture out and see for yourself, Jedi--or is the dark side's influence here too much for you?
I have a great idea--why don't you do some of the actual work around here?
The Jedi and myself are responsible for preserving this alliance, tenuous as it is.
That location is of great strategic value. Make clear to its inhabitants, whomever they are, that the facility is ours now.
There can be no mistaking it: the Emperor is on this moon.
Revan is here as well. And another presence, if you wish to believe the Grand Master.
The other presence--it's unclear. The dark side permeates everything here. Saturates it. I've been to Oricon; this is another level entirely.
Sounds about right.
Oricon was affected by the Dread Masters. Even their combined power was insignificant compared to the Emperor.
Gotta figure the Emperor runs circles around anyone else, far as that stuff goes.
I should think so. After all, this is the Emperor we're talking about.
You must be joking.
You're worthless, Satele.
Sounds to me like you're cracking up. Can't hack it. Maybe you oughta go back to Tython.
I'm not sure why you're here. It seems all you bring to the table are vague notions and squeamishness.
You should keep in mind that we're all in this together now.
The Order of Revan is garrisoned inside an old Massassi temple. That is where the dark side is most prevalent.
We carved out an area as close to the temple as we could. The high concentrations of Massassi in these parts made it difficult.
It didn't help that you knew about the Massassi but didn't bother to give a heads-up to our recon teams.
We must work together.
Like it or not, everyone needs to be getting along right now.
This is no time for in-fighting or deception. The stakes are far too high.
Agreed, we cannot let emotion cloud our judgment. More easily said than done for some, I suppose.
I thought you worked for an intelligence agency.
Pardon my intrusion, but perhaps we should avoid pointing fingers and focus on the problem at hand?
These two have just demonstrated a large part of our problem.
What's a Massassi?
They're your genetic cousins. Barbaric warriors from Korriban. I... thought you would know.
The genetic cousins of Sith Purebloods. Barbaric warriors. I thought you would know.
They're genetic cousins of the Sith. Barbaric warriors originally from Korriban.
Don't you teach your people anything, Lana?
Agent--compose yourself.
While Darth Marr and I have reached an accord, many of those under our command obviously don't share our sense of commitment.
If you were to assist in shoring up our position, it would serve as an example to the rest.
We can be pragmatic, if we choose to. Do what you do so well out there; I'll remain in touch.
Shall we proceed?
We await your decision.
Time is short.
You've returned.
Move quickly.
You have done well.
This world is worse than Rishi. Be careful.
This place is worse than Rishi! No cantinas, no sabacc games, no fun at all!
My master wishes to report that the surrounding terrain is quite rugged. The Revanites are based in an ancient temple nearby. We found no usable supplies or shelter.
The other scouts gave similar reports. There has been some contact with Revanite patrols, but no heavy resistance as yet.
I can feel the Emperor's presence here. I'd know it anywhere. But that presence isn't alone.
There is so much darkness here... it's difficult to get any sense of specifics in the environment.
The Emperor isn't the only Sith to have left his mark on this place.
We've got a base camp, elevation, decent perimeter... bring me up to speed on the rest.
Looks like you've settled in pretty well. Catch me up.
We need better eyes on the region around us. Scouts can only patrol so far in brush this dense.
It is more than that. I sense their fear. Their distrust. This world is mired in ancient hatreds, and we have brought more than our share already.
Was there a suggestion somewhere in all that?
The troops are too distracted by each other to keep a proper lookout. They're expecting to be stabbed in the back.
Then we'll set an extended perimeter past the outer guards, and make it impartial. Sensor equipment doesn't pick sides.
I can take care of that.
Good, I'm sick of this place already.
Once our position is secure, we can focus on Revan.
I'm going to get those sensors running. Keep me informed.
Do we know any more about how Revan is intending to bring the Emperor back?
Everything about the Emperor is a mystery, even to the Dark Council. Speed is our only ally now.
We'll keep in touch while you're getting those sensors up.
If you're thinking about attacking the others while I'm gone? Think again.
...I'm sure we'll be fine. I'll stay in contact while you're getting those sensors up.
Good luck.
You sense it too. Not the ancient Sith, or the Emperor. Not Revan. Another presence... different from the rest.
Yes. It is more like you.
I sense it too. Is it really possible that a light side presence could exist here?
The light can flourish anywhere.
Are you saying there's another Jedi somewhere near us?
No Jedi could survive here alone. It is a vestige at most.
You sell us a bit short, Marr.
But, in answer to your question, no: the presence isn't exactly that of a Jedi, either. It's still very difficult to pinpoint.
Sensors are picking up something a bit more solid. Large structures, mixture of ancient and modern materials... looks like they've been ransacked. Lots of debris.
Check for broadcasts in signal range forty-seven point two.
What am I seeing here? It's encoded.
The facts behind a rumor. That signal range is used only by the Imperial Guard. The structure we've found must be their training facility.
I fought the Imperial Guard on Corellia. They were dangerous opponents.
Among the most dangerous in the galaxy.
They might be broadcasting something we could use. Can you decode it?
No--only the Guard has that capability. But given the destruction Theron describes, it's most likely a distress call.
Rumor? Are you telling us you never knew where the Imperial Guard came from?
The Emperor's inner circle guards its secrets carefully.
If the Guard has a facility here, they may have information on the Emperor's hiding place--that would lead us straight to Revan.
Agreed. As this concerns only Imperial interests, I will assemble a team of my own to investigate. Beniko--with me.
We can't sit back and watch. There's no telling what they might pull out of that facility--we can't just take their word for it.
Hurry--while Marr is gathering his team. Make your way out of the camp and search the Imperial Guard base, as quickly as possible.
We'll stall the Imps as much as we can. Let's just hope this doesn't turn ugly....
Be careful.
We'll need our full strength to defeat Revan when the time comes. Don't do anything to jeopardize that.
The Sith are prone to aggression as it is. Don't give them a reason to indulge their darkness.
Don't start a fight just to cover for me. It's not worth the risk.
Just don't get in over your heads. That's more my specialty.
We won't.
Are you sure this is wise?
No one knows betrayal better than Sith. They won't ignore what we're doing here.
Trust is in very short supply right now. I'm not sure it's best to gamble what little we have.
I've seen more than one covert op that backfired when the truth came out. Is this worth the risk?
Nobody likes getting conned, and Sith aren't exactly forgiving. Doing this could wreck the truce for good.
We don't have any other options. Trust is hard enough when we're on even footing. If they get an edge on us? Forget it.
Please, hurry. And may the Force be with you.
Ugly is fine with me.
Try not to start any serious fighting until I'm back. I wouldn't want to miss out.
If I return, and all of the Imperials are dead? All the better.
If things get bloody, just be sure to leave some Imps for me.
I wouldn't mind seeing a few less Imps around camp when I get back.
Let's just hope it doesn't come to that, huh?
May the Force be with you.
This was an Imperial matter. Your Jedi had no place in it.
I told you this was an Imperial matter. Your soldier's involvement was... unwelcome.
This was an Imperial matter. Your... associate... was not needed.
We're supposed to be working together. If the situations were reversed, wouldn't you have done the same thing?
You don't trust us.
If you trusted us, having me involved wouldn't have been an issue.
This is a dangerous game you play.
We were concerned, and we acted. We should have left this to you. Apologies.
You don't speak for them.
Betrayal is the core of your beliefs! You can't honestly find this surprising.
Is it surprise that you hear in my voice?
Kill each other now, wait until later, it's all the same! It all fuels the flame!
Enough. I will wrench the information we need from this... man. The rest can be settled later.
Why not let Master Satele have a try at that?
Do not push me further.
Violence is what drove him into his current state. More will only make him worse.
You're welcome to observe everything. But a gentler hand will be more successful--I'm sure of it.
I'm betting the Guard are trained to resist torture.
I've got a feeling torture is something this guy has seen plenty of.
It can't hurt to try something different. You're free to watch--no secrets.
Let's get this over with.
It's more like therapy in there than an interrogation. I think we're close to a breakthrough, though.
Master Satele's techniques are... interesting. And rather effective, I must admit. I think we'll have the information we need very soon.
Interrogate him however you see fit.
I encourage you to observe. I have no need for secrets.
Allowing this torture makes us no better than Revan.
We can be better than Revan after he's dealt with.
I need to meditate on the path ahead. There must be a way forward without such sacrifices.
And at least a few of us had better check up on Marr and Lana.
It's not pretty in there. Don't think the guy can hold out much longer, though.
