We cut it pretty close on this one. Doesn't take a Jedi to see how angry Marr was.
How are you holding up? Everything has been happening so fast....
I've been through my share of tough times. I can handle this.
Good to hear. I have a feeling things are only going to get tougher.
You had mentioned that you weren't particularly close to your mother... has working together been good or bad?
Honestly, I'm not sure. There hasn't been a lot of time to think about it. But we work well together.
We've been chasing Revan down long enough. I just want to end this.
I couldn't agree more.
Darth Marr's techniques are quite effective. I don't believe we'll have much longer to wait.
I want you to know, I advised against Marr's plan with the Guard facility.
We've come so far together... I'd hate to see that progress ruined by territoriality.
This truce is only as strong as our trust in each other.
Then with our guidance, I think it can only become stronger as we proceed.
Are you worried about keeping the truce together, or were you thinking more about the two of us?
Both, I suppose.
If you don't agree with Marr, why follow him? Just kill him and take his place--that's how it works for Sith, isn't it?
Short-sighted infighting is what brought the Empire to its current state. I won't take part in that.
The guard broke! He is telling them everything!
I thought the interrogation we faced on Manaan was severe... Darth Marr made that little session seem like a picnic!
I must say, Master Satele is quite a pleasant interrogator. Theron should be quite proud!
Let's find out what we're up against.
A "device for mass ritual sacrifice"? That's seriously what he called it?
Capable of killing every living thing on this moon, as fuel for the Emperor's resurrection.
And housed within the very temple the Revanites are using as their base of operations.
So we'll have to breach the temple and shut the weapon down before Revan can activate it.
Getting inside at all will be challenging enough.
The temple entrance has a locking system that can be overridden from the outside, provided we find the right mechanisms.
On it.
It is strange that one bad deal could lead us to such bizarre circumstances.
I certainly never thought we'd be killed by an ancient Sith murder machine!
The life of Jakarro has been full of fine adventures, but this one is the greatest of all.
I thank you, tiny friends.
We're fortunate to have run into each other.
This has all been much more fun than dying at the bottom of an ocean!
You might not be so grateful if we don't get that weapon shut down.
I have never seen you fail before! You will not start now.
We didn't exactly have a choice. Everywhere we go, you follow.
You need our help! There is no shame in admitting it.
Think I've found the locks Iven mentioned. You'd better get out there and take a look--we'll feed you info as we find it.
May the Force serve you well.
Good luck.
Your actions are... confusing, to say the least. I don't appreciate being left in the dark.
Does the Supreme Commander share these concerns, Chancellor?
He does not. But that is hardly--
The two of us have been fighting this war for quite some time now. We know what we're doing--and we appreciate your trust in us.
Just as I'll appreciate being informed when your fleet is back in position. Saresh out.
I guess ignoring the boss runs in the family.
Where are we planning to go from here?
Back to toeing the line, at least for a while.
There's nothing left for us on Yavin Four anyway. No point in staying.
Ignoring Saresh is always a good idea.
Never knew you were so political.
Our forces are preparing to launch.
I should make sure ours are ready to do the same.
It's strange. The next time we meet, our circumstances will be... quite different.
Well, don't take it personally, but I'm hoping that you'll never see me again.
Hah. And I'll hope that I do.
I'm gonna see if Satele needs any help. Catch me later.
Well. Our time has come, even sooner than I'd feared.
Revan is gone. We've accomplished what we set out to do. But now we have an entirely new problem, and no truce to face it.
Do you know if the Dark Council has a plan for how to move forward?
I don't, though Marr did ask to speak with me as soon as we've launched.
We've shown that it's possible to ignore our differences. Maybe there's hope for a real treaty.
Despite our work here, trust is still in short supply. We can thank the Revanites for that.
I'm not afraid of the Emperor. He'll be taken care of soon enough.
I wish I shared your optimism.
What's next for the illustrious Jedi? It sounded as though your Grand Master is about to become quite busy.
I will go wherever the Council decides I'm needed. That's the life of a Jedi.
We aren't so different after all.
I walk whatever path the Force lays out for me.
You always seem to find your way into the middle of grand things regardless.
If you were to abandon the Sith, I imagine I'd be busy teaching you our ways.
I'm afraid that won't be possible.
What's next for the Republic's most decorated soldier? Surely even Havoc Squad gets vacations every now and then?
With everything that's happened, I doubt I'll have the chance for any vacation.
Neither will I.
Maybe I'll just disappear for a bit. Surely the Republic can get by without me for a little while.
I'd say you've earned it. Though I doubt your superiors would be interested in my opinion.
Bringing in a Sith defector will mean lots of forms to fill out. It'd be worth it, though.
I appreciate the offer, but... no.
What's next for the galaxy's most notorious smuggler? After everything that's happened, I imagine you're even more in-demand than ever.
I go where the work is, and the Republic's bound to have a lot of it coming up.
Yes, I'd say so.
I'm sure the Republic will ask me for one thing or another. Parades, banquets... few medals, of course.
Of course.
But I'll probably just take off on my own for a bit first. It's about time I enjoyed some of my credits again.
As sound a plan as I've ever heard.
I was figuring we'd be going on a tour of the galaxy's finer hot spots.
If only.
I'm not at all sure what my future holds. But the future doesn't have to start for a while yet.
For now... I'd like to make the most of the present.
Agreed. [Kiss her]
There's nothing I'd like more.
I'm going to miss you.
I'm going to miss you, too, Lana.
Give me a call if you ever want to change sides.
You'll be the first to know.
Come on. Sith aren't supposed to go in for all that mushy nonsense.
Sith do whatever they like.
We've gone as far as we can go, Lana. Any further, and we'll both regret it.
Hm. Suit yourself. But I would rather regret something I did, than something I was afraid to do.
Stay safe.
I'm glad we could put aside our differences and achieve so much. It's been quite interesting.
It's been a pleasure working with you, Lana. Strange, but a pleasure.
You don't have to go back, Lana. You aren't like them.
I appreciate the invitation. But the Empire is my home.
This truce ends the moment you're gone. If we meet again, don't expect any mercy.
A traditional Sith farewell. You're so thoughtful.
Until next time.
Well. Quite a ride, huh? Revan's down, the conspiracy's over... I even got my job back. Wonders never cease.
The SIS is lucky to have you back.
Can I get that in writing?
With the Emperor back, I have a feeling things are going to get even more interesting.
I'd bet on it.
The Emperor still managed to come back. I'd call that a mixed result at best.
We did everything we possibly could have.
It's funny. You're this famous Jedi, but since we started working together, you've been a spy, a saboteur, a fake pirate... How'd you pull it all off so well?
A Jedi's responsibilities can lead to many different situations. Adaptability is important.
Our jobs have a lot in common.
With help as good as you, everything is easy.
I could say the same about you.
Honestly, I feel more at home with all of that than I ever have meditating in the temple.
Can't say that surprises me too much.
I always knew you were one hell of a soldier. But it turns out you can swing the spy game, work undercover, even run with a bunch of pirates.
Soldiers are only as good as their training, and I went through my share.
Then your teachers deserve some medals.
I did it all because I had your help every step of the way.
Other than when I was captured. But I appreciate the sentiment.
Following orders, staying in formations... I've never been big on any of it. Missions like this are much more exciting.
Don't have to convince me.
I wasn't surprised that you could hold your own with the underworld crowd. But all this spycraft, sabotage, tracking down targets... not exactly textbook smuggler stuff.
I don't know how else to explain it. I'm just really good at everything.
That a fact?
If I'd known there was a textbook, I'd have pretended to read it by now.
There can't be much left to learn anyway.
It's possible you might have pitched in a little bit along the way.
I guess there's at least an outside chance.
Before we get going... there's just one last thing I had in mind. If you think you can keep up.
You're on. [Kiss him]
...Is that what you had in mind?
It's a start.
Just like I thought. Good at everything.
Come on. Let's go see what's next for the best in the Republic.
I've had fun, Theron. But you have your life, and I have mine. We'd never match up.
Hm. Can't win 'em all, I guess.
Come on. Let's go check up on the bosses.
Come on. We'd better go check up on the bosses.
The Imperials are leaving a small force of volunteers behind to watch for any further activity from the Revanites or the Emperor. We'll be doing the same.
Don't count me as one of your volunteers!
As it happens, Jakarro and I have received several lucrative business offers. Various acquaintances made on Rishi, nothing to concern yourselves with.
That being said, we have sincerely enjoyed our time with you, and would gladly provide our services again at any time!
The droid babbles, but speaks the truth. This has been fun!
I hope these new opportunities go better than the Manaan job. Take care.
We will do that! No one will fool the mighty Jakarro again!
Why go work with someone else? I'd be happy to have you stick around and join my crew.
A tempting offer!
The mighty Jakarro will consider it--but for now, these deals are too good to pass up!
I honestly can't believe we put up with you as long as we did. Beat it.
How dare you! After everything we've done!
Forget this, we have credits to make!
There's more for us to discuss.
Your work against Revan and his followers has been truly exceptional. And your expertise in combating the Emperor is second to none.
You embody every ideal in the Jedi Code. The Council is unanimous in its decision to name you Battlemaster of the order.
The Council has often sensed darkness in your actions, and we hope to guide you away from such influence. But your prowess cannot be dismissed.
You do not always follow a path the Council understands. But we have seen the results of your unorthodox approach time and again.
I hereby name you Battlemaster of the Jedi Order.
As Battlemaster, your strategic insights will guide the Council's decisions, and you will share your lightsaber skills with the order's most promising students.
But most important of all, you will lead the charge against the Sith Emperor, along with any who choose to follow him.
I am honored to be chosen for this role in the order. I will do everything I can to fulfill my duties with wisdom and skill.
With your help, I believe we can finally bring an end to the Emperor's assaults on the galaxy.
I'm ready. How should we begin?
It's good to know that the Council finally appreciates what I'm capable of.
What we are capable of and what we accomplish are often different. We're hoping you'll accomplish a great deal of good in the galaxy.
Your role in bringing light to the Revanites' conspiracy is only further proof of your tremendous skill and connection to the Force.
What's more, you've battled against the Children of the Emperor and triumphed where so many others fell.
The order needs to remain vigilant against the Emperor's influences, and to uncover the true origins of his power so that we can fight him more effectively.
The Council is proud to have such an ideal Jedi to lead those efforts.
Despite the darkness we have sensed in you, the Council can think of no one better suited to lead those efforts.
You walk a... unique path, but your insights are equally unique, and the council believes that you are the best choice for our investigations.
Congratulations, Barsen'thor. You will be the light that guides us through the coming darkness.
This is a grave task, and I'm honored that you would entrust it to me.
Knowledge will be our greatest weapon in the battles to come.
There's no time to waste--the Emperor is already far ahead of us. Where can I begin?
After all that I've accomplished, you think this is a suitable reward?
It was not intended as a reward.
Thanks to your old boss, SpecForce division is going through some changes. We can't afford to lose Havoc Squad in that mire of bureaucracy.
A special joint task force is being assembled between the Jedi, the SIS, and the military. Destroying the Sith Emperor is the group's sole purpose.
On the recommendation of Supreme Commander Malcom, you have been appointed to serve as the task force's primary military advisor. Congratulations.
I can't think of a more important mission to be a part of. I'm honored.
We're lucky to have you.
Do we have any intel to act on yet?
I'll take whatever title you want. But don't expect me to sit behind a desk.
Wouldn't dream of it. "Primary military advisor" just sounded nicer than "head bad-guy killer."
If this situation with the Revanites has proven anything, it's the value of having eyes and ears outside of the Republic.
You've done good work as a licensed privateer, but the SIS wants you to be able to go even further.
This card is programmed with authorization codes from the director of the SIS himself. Complete immunity from Republic prosecution of any kind.
Take any job you can find, if you think it might lead to information on the Emperor and his followers. I mean it.
The minute I hear anything useful, I'll send it your way.
This has to be the best reward I've ever gotten for a job. I can't decide where to go first!
Just remember, that only works for Republic security forces. You get arrested on some unaligned planet nobody's heard of, you're on your own.
Yeah, sure, I'll get right on that.
Just don't make us regret trusting you, all right?
We're attempting to calculate where the Emperor might have gone, but we don't know enough about his capabilities to determine anything for sure.
While we get the task force up and running, we're going to need you out there, acting on your own. Follow every lead you can find.
And remember, the threat of the Empire remains--they will not hesitate to use this situation to gain an advantage over us.
Until the Emperor is destroyed for good, the entire galaxy is in danger. We must be ready.
My team shut down the Sith device. Revan tried to intervene, but we managed to drive him away.
Impressive. We have prepared a joint assault force to secure the area and pacify any remaining enemies.
All units report success. The temple is secured, and all remaining Revanites have been downed. Just one left, now.
Are we ready?
All teams report ready. You've done very well--all of the soldiers here look up to you, Imperial and Republic both.
Let's proceed.
All units--move out!
All units report success. The weapon has been shut down, and all Revanites neutralized. Only one more left to deal with.
Iven told us where Revan might go. The Emperor's final sanctuary.
We've got speeders prepped. You won't be facing him alone.
Then let's begin.
I'll take all the backup I can get. Let's move.
Well, then. Let's settle this so we can all go home.
Watching Darth Marr pace. That guy redefines intense.
I don't know about Lana anymore. I'm keeping an eye on her.
Online and doing its thing.
We're receiving, loud and clear.
Got a signal.
Bet you anything it's less tense out there than it is in here. All the same, watch yourself.
Watch out for those Massassi. They're no joke.
Keep it up. You'll have the Empire working with us yet.
Becoming less and less hostile around here. We'll get there.
You won't get Marr and Satele to hold hands, but your headway's bringing us closer to a working alliance.
Just when we think it's all over....
You ready for this?
Revan won't have a chance to use that weapon. We won't let that happen.
The Imperial Guard... this just keeps getting better.
Glad to have you handling this.
Watch your back.
Master Shan asked me to convey her appreciation.
You should see the way Theron glares at me.
We are receiving.
We have it. Reading clear.
The signal's good.
Darth Marr and I both sense a growing presence. We're almost certain it's due to your activities.
From all accounts, the Massassi warriors here are the most savage of all. Be wary.
I've noticed fewer clenched jaws from the Republic. They're warming to us.
Your work is having a positive effect all around.
Our pact with the Republic is coming along--thanks to your effectiveness out there.
The worst may be ahead, but that does not diminish your efforts this day.
The disturbance grows. Revan cannot be allowed to proceed.
The temple. We must gain access.
I'll be interested to see who you find.
Our truce must hold. Everything depends on it.
I hope you enjoy dying!
You should never have come here!
You'll all get what's coming to you!
For Revan!
I'm done playing around!
Blast it!

YAVIN 4 COALITION FORCES BULLETIN Forward Camp Preservation
The monitoring beacons you installed to help establish our factional forward camps have been ravaged by the local wildlife. To maintain a foothold in the swamps and jungles of Yavin 4, the beacons must be replaced.

YAVIN 4 COALITION FORCES BULLETIN Training Camp Defense
Revanite forces are taking advantage of your removal of Commandant Iven and his Imperial Guardsmen from the training camp by attempting to establish a forward camp there. Send those Revanites packing.

Aid the Coalition Forces on Yavin 4 by completing 8 of the following daily missions in any combination of your choice within a week:
[DAILY] Altars of History [DAILY] Chopping Block [DAILY] Confederacy [DAILY] Hunters Hunted [DAILY] Pathfinding [DAILY] Pushback [DAILY] The Devoted Ones [DAILY] Training Regimen

Relive the climactic battle of Yavin 4, fighting against Revan alongside Grand Master Satele Shan, Darth Marr, Lana Beniko, Theron Shan, Shae Vizla and Jakarro. (And C2-D4!)
This fight may be repeated once per week.

YAVIN 4 COALITION FORCES BULLETIN Revanite Walker Sighting
An armored walker piloted by a follower of Revan has been spotted near the Imperial Guard Training Grounds. As it is of great importance that we hold the Revanites back from our position, the removal of this formidable target has been identified as a top priority.
Viridian Squad hasn't reported in. They were scouting the Massassi village.
Your scouts were captured by Massassi. I freed the survivors. Their commander left a message.
Sergeant Jung, dead. Blast it. I'll put her in for a commendation along with her men.
Viridian Squad's a bunch of blasted heroes. So are you.
You did good. You and Jung both. We'll get a report from the team and get the injured off-planet... and try to keep this from happening again.

Viridian Squad Reconnaissance Update (Sergeant Era Jung commanding):
Well, that didn't work out.
The Massassi were on us as soon as we left the drop zone. They don't watch from the shadows anymore--we're their new favorite prey.
The team went down fast. Survivors got dragged in the direction of the Massassi village. Enemy must have assumed the hole in my gut had killed me. If you're reading this, my one-woman rescue attempt ended badly.
Sorry to disappoint you, Major Tso. You always said a rich girl like me shouldn't be in charge. Guess you win the argument by default.
They ambushed us. That was smart. They should've killed us then.
Massassi freaks killed my buddies. They're not killing any more.
You saved my life. We were dead, and you--thank you.
They were going to kill us. I don't know how. I don't even know why....
Don't know how you found us, but back at base? Drinks are on me.
I can make it back to camp. Stay strong out here.
Perimeter's holding strong. We're moving forward, meter at a time.
I've thinned the pack. If you're going to secure a beachhead, now's the time.
Understood. I'll call it in--maybe we'll see more action than fangs and claws after all.
My lord! Watch your step out here! The jungle's got eyes.
Hey! You might watch your pace--speed attracts the wildlife.
Any support you can give, we'll take it.
We'll be out of blaster packs before these things back off.
They promised us Spawnhunter Division. Bunch of overtrained idiots and zookeepers with guns; supposed to keep the animals off us.
Spawnhunters are all dead. At this rate, we'll be eaten before we see a Revanite.
We'll hold the line here.
The wildlife is under control for now. You'll have room to maneuver.
Right. Yes, sir.
I was on Felucia. I know nasty jungles. This is something else.
If we don't get massive support soon, we're all dead. And I didn't sign up to get eaten.
END DIALOGUE
Those things out there... they're pure death.
Hey. Hey! What kind of jungle is this? Those animals bite through armor!
What's going on?
I'm... sorry about before. This jungle, this whole moon... I'm not a coward, but it does something to your head.
END DIALOGUE
We can't even hold a perimeter. The joint force is falling apart.
You were right. The Revanites rely too heavily on their commanders for direction.
Ah, how wonderful to hear. I so hope the Republic will celebrate victory with us before the knives must be unsheathed.
You are too kind to my humble self. We forget sometimes that unity, not obedience, is the true strength of our Empire.
We embark soon. My soldiers rest and luxuriate while they can.
Onward to victory, my friend.
Remove the commanders, and the rank-and-file will thrash like a worm out of dirt. Do so in strength and do so in joy.
Celebrate our victory today--for tomorrow, we may give our life to achieve it.
My sisters, my sons... we drink together, to celebrate this mission as we have so many others. To share in our purpose.
To you, Lord Ray'en! To the Empire!
Indeed. Yet the Revanites have no guiding purpose or ideals, as we do. Their minds are weak, molded by the cultists above them in the hierarchy.
Your arrival has been foreseen....
You must press on....
You're close. I feel it.
It's time. You've finally arrived.
Revan. But... you're alive. Leading the Revanites.
Now I've seen everything. Aren't you supposed to be... alive?
The brooding monster inside those temple walls, he is not Revan. He is an abomination.
His obsession, his arrogance, this angry crusade--it's all blinded him to the truth. The many lives he'll sacrifice to revive the Emperor will be nothing compared to what will follow.
It's within your power to stop the abomination. But you won't be able to do it alone.
May the Force be with you....
The Jedi and I, we both felt it--a ripple in the Force. You had a visitor. A manifestation.
It was Revan. But not the Revan we've been after this whole time.
We both suspected that may be the case. It doesn't matter who's inside that temple. What's important is that we end his plan.
Revan wants me to succeed, but claims I can't do it on my own.
It appeared to be Revan. He claims to be on our side, and that the one we've been chasing isn't him after all.
He said he was Revan, and the one we've been after isn't. I'm not entirely sure I buy it.
That all remains to be seen. And for now, it's irrelevant. All that matters is that we stop the Revanites.
He didn't seem to think I could do it on my own.
It had to be a trick of the Force. Some strange attempt by Revan to confuse me.
It said it was Revan, and that it's on our side.
Whatever you witnessed, you must put it behind you and look ahead to the enemy within.
All told, the Revanites may be the fiercest adversaries we've ever faced, and this temporary alliance with the Republic is unstable at best.
We must gather our forces. We must endure. The fate of not only the Empire but the galaxy itself depends on it.
Good. You have opened the way.
Revan? How is this possible?
Through the Force, anything is possible.
When the Emperor's followers struck me down... I learned to release my attachments.
Then who's wearing your mask and leading your followers?
I... do not know. But I recognize much of myself in him. The darkness I left behind.
He must be stopped. His fury will only strengthen the Emperor, not destroy him.
Your descendants are close by--Satele and Theron Shan. Why speak to me instead of them?
I must remain apart from them. My attachments have always driven me too far, and I have always refused to see it.
I'm sorry I wasn't there to fight with you. We might have been able to avoid all of this.
It's good that you didn't. I told myself that I was not altered by my centuries in the Emperor's grasp....
But my actions were those of a madman, consumed by rage. I am glad to have left such evil behind.
You must do what I could not.
If you know how to stop this madness, tell me.
You are on the right path. Continue. Survive. Persevere.
You've done it! The way is opening!
I just spoke to Revan.
You... what? He was there?
It was his spirit. He couldn't tell me who's wearing his mask, but he did confirm that trying to kill the Emperor wouldn't work.
The man who tortured me was an imposter? How could he know so much?
We can sort that out when we face him. For now, we need to focus on the weapon he has primed inside the temple.
You're right. We're only going to get one shot at this... once our forces enter the temple, it's only a matter of time until our friend pulls the trigger.
A joint strike--committing all of our forces and the Empire's--has a good chance of pushing through the temple and disabling the weapon before it can fire.
An operation like that needs perfect coordination--and trust. It might take some doing to get our troops working together at that level.
Perhaps a smaller team would be a better option?
What about a small-unit operation?
We could get a smaller group in faster and more quietly.
A small team might be able to infiltrate the temple and reach the device before it can be activated. But they'll be facing some steep odds.
The joint strike is safer.
You have led the mission this far. Our victory is within reach--we'll let you decide how best to achieve it.
A small team will work best.
Revan's spirit....
Help has arrived.
Keep waiting to hear that this is all some ploy, like we're here to lull the Republic into a false sense of security.
If only. That would mean we weren't teaming up out of necessity to take down a threat too big to handle alone.
I know I'm not cleared, but I heard rumors. Is it really him behind this? Darth Revan?
I'm going to assume it is. In my experience, it's best to assume the worst.
What's the word, corporal? Imperials been up to anything shady?
Sergeant now, actually. Got a field promotion after my sarge was hauled away. He was one of the traitors.
Wow, that's-- Congratulations?
I guess--except now I feel like I can't trust my own people. And we're supposed to trust those Imps, too?
Yeah, it's bad all around. Stay sharp.
So many of my people--yours--went and signed up for this Revan stuff. What do you think they see in all that?
I suppose they don't like what the Republic or Empire have to offer, so they chose option three.
But having their option means tearing down everything we've built and killing us to boot--that's crazy.
How does that differ from what we'll be getting up to once this temporary truce is over? Here--let me finish patching you up.
I had a shot at Darth Marr, clear as day.
What? You didn't take it?
When I saw him through my scope, I could, you know, feel him. Like he knew I was trained on him. He didn't even flinch.
Well, sounds like we need to try to work with those guys, anyway. Maybe it's for the best you lost your nerve.
Yeah, maybe-- Hey.
I don't like this at all. We're in striking distance of the Republic and what are we doing about it? Nothing. We're at war!
My recon team came across some Reps covering the same ground. Thought we'd get the drop on them.
Are they dead? Tell me they're dead.
They're dead all right, but we didn't kill them. Massassi warriors jumped them. Us, too. I'm all that's left.
So... okay, good to know.
Update: I am activating internal dehumidification systems to compensate for the environment. Please inform me if we are to remain here for over a month.
From the stars, I thought this might be my homeworld. My world looks much the same. But I think I am not sad. Much more to explore here.
No fighting, no gambling, no contraband. This isn't an army base--it's a prison camp.
Can you feel it? The gravity of the gas giant urges us skyward, as if we could spread wings and ascend. This world is more than it appears.
I tried a HoloNet search on Yavin before we came here. Lots of urban legends and ghost stories. The first few were fun, but... it's not fun anymore.
Clean air. Cleaner than Taris. Strange smells, though. Can't trust your senses.
Rishi was more my speed--raiders and pirates, and not a temple or ancient relic in sight. Guess you like Yavin better.
The Jedi never talked to me about Yavin. There were stories, and I asked about them, but I was always told I wasn't ready. Am I ready now, my lord?
The circumstances may be dire, but in truth, my lord, it's good to be among our forces again. There is nothing on Yavin that can stop us.
I feel like if we take one wrong step, this truce'll break. I also feel like this planet--moon, whatever--is going to eat us. Can we go yet?
Yavin Four, huh? Place is kind of pretty from here. Don't think I want to go any farther, but we can at least say we made the trip.
We're surrounded by Sith on a Sith planet. Are you as uncomfortable with this as I am? Because if you are, we're doomed.
Watch your hydration here, Jedi. In this heat, you'll sweat out a liter before you know it. Can't have you wither on my watch.
The heat, the moisture--I feel like I'm going to wilt. Is it like this for your species?
Normally I enjoy an empty world, Captain--trees and greenery far as you can see. This place, though? Really makes me miss Coruscant.
Even before the Empire returned, the worst criminals in the galaxy wouldn't hide on Yavin Four. There are reasons no one goes here.
Watch your back--alliance or not, I bet there's more than a few Imps here who'd like to drop Havoc Squad's commander.
Part of me is glad to see we can put aside our differences with the Empire if need be. But I also fear how this will end.
Stupid jungle. What am I stepping in? If it were Hutt filth, at least I'd know there was something fun around.
The aura of life here is blinding, but its sound is cacophanous. The jungle struggles for its spirit as each bud and insect struggles for survival.
Promise me one thing on your honor: If we live through this--if we get through this squishy, stinky jungle--you will buy me new boots.
Thick growth, high canopy. New environment to learn. Perfect place to hunt.
There's something mean here, Sith. I'm not a fan of nature walks, but this jungle doesn't seem right.
The dark side is powerful here. It's like the trees are on fire with it.
I trained in the jungles of Dromund Kaas, but those were a garden compared to this. Be wary and watch your footing.
My lekku are dripping from the humidity and I swear I smell something rotting. Dromund Kaas was scary, but there's something really wrong here.
Offer: I possess numerous training programs of my own, master. If desired, I can hunt any of your associates through this environment for a positive learning experience.
We are hunted by many, Chief. This is good. Tomorrow we make trophy flags from their cloaks!
Guardsmen! I am the Emperor! I have possessed this awesome body! Strip and kneel before me!
We always thought the Imperial Guard were noble--dedicated to an ideal of service above all. Our Empire loses itself by the day.
No one can say the Imperial Guard isn't brave. You have to be brave to wear bright red on a planet like this.
Enemy training grounds. Nowhere more dangerous. Didn't save the Guard. Careful.
The Revanites, the Imperial Guard... they're all dupes, worshiping one Force-using maniac or another. No offense.
The Imperial Guard--the servants of the galaxy's greatest evil, already brought to ruin. What are we facing?
As a child, I idolized the Guard. To serve the Emperor as they did was the greatest honor a non-Sith could achieve. Now... look at them. Look at us.
The Imperial Guard really lives here? What do you think that does to your head?
Can you imagine training in a place like this? Hard to picture anyone coming out with their head on straight.
I don't like this place. There's something familiar about it. I haven't been here, but I've seen it before... It belongs to the Emperor.
Lot of stories about the Imperial Guard back in the army. They scared us more than Sith--ordinary people who could take out a full platoon.
If we could stop the fighting, I'd walk through these ruins for days. Look at them... and yet the Empire uses them to train.
Real guerilla warfare is bad enough. Faking it on a training facility using live ammo? Just a little bit worse.
The Empire says one Imperial Guardsman is worth a hundred ordinary troops. Looks like the Revanites got a discount.
The Guardsmen must know every meter of these ruins. Didn't save them from the Revanites. Stay alert.
If you'd told me as a little girl I'd one day visit the Imperial Guard training grounds, I'd have expected it to be the highlight of my life.
Analysis: The structural integrity of Massassi is far superior to that of the baseline Sith species, master, but well within my favored target parameters.
My tribe builds better villages. My tribe builds better defenses. But my people are much smaller. Maybe size and strength make creatures stupid.
Massassi. One more of those things looks at me, and I will wear its tentacles around my fist.
Could all the Empire have become like the Massassi, if things had gone differently? Could we still become this way?
Don't wander off, okay? I would sort of rather not be left alone with the Massassi.
Too bad we're in a hurry. I'd like to watch these Massassi. See them live in the jungle.
Never thought much about becoming a human sacrifice before. Not something I had to worry about before we came here.
The creatures here--I want to hate them, but I can't. They were bred to be savage, raised in this culture. I pity them.
There are carvings of the Massassi in the Heritage Museum in Kaas City. Their savagery is great, but their blood is far purer than mine.
When I have bad dreams about Korriban and scary monsters coming for me in jail? Those scary monsters pretty much look like Massassi.
After careful consideration, when it comes to getting to know the locals? I think I liked the Rishii better.
This is what you get when you're as obsessed with blood purity as the Empire. Kind of feel sorry for these guys.
These Massassi--they're like Sith Purebloods, right? Guess we should feel lucky they're not all Force sensitive.
What do you suppose the Massassi would do if they had ships and technology like us? Could they ever join the Republic?
Makes me feel a little better to think we'll never see these guys again after Yavin Four. We won't--right, Captain?
I've seen friendlier welcomes from Trandoshan hunting parties. Let's not stick around too long.
Don't let these guys get close. They're strong enough to peel us out of our armor if we let 'em.
Evolutionarily speaking, the Massassi are fascinating. They were genetically altered from Sith, then naturally adapted to the jungle. Pity they won't consent to a study.
Warning: The nearby temple is difficult to penetrate with sensors, master. I advise extreme caution.
Great darkness is in the temple, Chief. I know this. You know this too. We go together.
Old. Ugly. Smells like death. I'm sick of temples that remind me of growing up. What'll it take to blow it up?
The temple--we don't have the words for it. It crawls with shadow. It lives like night.
You know, between Dromund Kaas and Oricon and Voss... I just can't look at a temple anymore without getting chills. Maybe this one's a nice temple?
Temple looks old. But check the tracks. Lots of movement. Be careful.
Few tonnes of detonite would do that place good. Assuming it even scratched the surface.
The statue--I recognize Naga Sadow from my studies. He was a Dark Lord from the time of the Emperor. There must be power here.
Look at that temple. Note the construction, the outer layout. It was built as more than a monument--it was built as a stronghold.
Hey, I know that temple! I mean, I haven't been here before, but I swear I've stolen Sith-y things with pictures of it. Neat.
Whoever that statue's of, I've got this weird feeling he wouldn't want us here. At least not without us tied up and turned on a spit.
That temple--it reminds me a lot of Korriban. But it's quieter. Just as old, but... not awake yet. Not completely.
I'm sure you could tell me the history of that temple, Jedi, but I'm going to stop you right now. I really don't want to know.
That temple--it gives me a terrible feeling. I don't think you should go in there.
You'd think someone would have looted that statue by now, all the centuries it's been there. Really worries me it looks good as new.
There's something wrong with that temple, Captain. I can't explain what or how I know--it's just wrong.
That temple's a death trap. Funnel invaders right in and slaughter them. Who was expecting a war on Yavin?
Sir, I find I'm slightly hyperventilating when I look at that statue. It may be a cultural fear response. If so, I apologize.
Recalibration: Apologies master, but I am receiving excessive targeting data from the plethora of small mammals and invertebrates; deprioritizing them now.
Good trees, good dirt, good place for battles endless. I will lead, Chief. I know forests well.
Knew an infectious disease expert who specialized in natural cures--plant extracts, that kind of thing. Me, I just wonder how the jungle will try to kill me.
The dark side is strong here. It's not the jungle itself--it's like the jungle is flooded with it.
Jungle warfare. Don't think I've done this since Felucia. Didn't like it much then, either.
My world is a place of dangerous forests--very like this jungle, and very different. The beasts will make me homesick.
Got enough supply packs for a few days in this jungle, but let's try not to need 'em. Meaning we should be quick--not, you know, die real fast.
I'm better with cities than with jungles, but even I know this place isn't friendly to strangers. Let's be careful.
Heat like this makes you feel the weight of your armor. Stay focused. Fatigue makes you fight stupid.
We'll both need full bioscans when we get back to the ship--General Medical Order 627-A. This jungle is designated a hostile biome.
[Eerie whispers]
[Eerie whispers]
[Eerie whispers]
[Eerie whispers]
In defeating me, you let the real enemy linger on. You... you doom the galaxy!
Say what you will about the Emperor; you're the one presenting a threat right now.
Had you been successful, had you brought the Emperor back, you would have made the galaxy's destruction all but a certainty.
You got it wrong. Bringing the Emperor back--that would mean we're all done for.
Keeping the Emperor as he is, that means there's an outside chance, yes. What you were up to would've resulted in a sure thing.
She's right, you know.
He's right, you know.
No. Not you.
You've been so blinded by your unchecked rage, your thirst for vengeance, that you could not see the truth.
Now that your power has subsided, I may finally confront you. I only hope you will listen.
You're both Revan.
Yes, though neither of us is truly Revan.
What exactly is happening here?
I was handling this.
And you've done well.
When I died, I had come to terms. I was ready to become one with the Force. But I soon realized that was only what part of me wanted.
I cast you out! It was the only way to go on--to remain and finish what we started! You were holding me back!
You think you're stronger this way, but you're not. Neither of us is. We're broken. We can't go on like this.
I won't stop. Not until I conjure the Emperor. I have to face him.
You wanted my return. You did not need to destroy whole fleets or turn a living world barren for that....
You only had to point the Empire and Republic to a shared adversary, and let them do what they do naturally: make war.
The scores of dead have nourished me. I am awakened. And I bring with me--death!
Do not fret, Wrath. You are still special to me. That is why I will kill you last.
The Emperor was not as strong as he might have been had Revan succeeded, but he was strong enough.
No.... He was supposed to face me.... To....
You're too weak. You won't last.
I.... If we unite, what I am--won't it fade? Become diminished...?
Lord Wrath. You have endured betrayal upon betrayal.
Dark Lord. Even I look in awe at your accelerated rise to power.
Bounty hunter. No outsider has ever held as much sway with the Empire as you hold now.
Commander. Even without the support you'd grown accustomed to, you still thrive like none other.
You did not get where you are today through kindness or moderation. It has served you well.
You find value in restraint, in virtue. Look at how well your way has served you.
You strike a balance within yourself. A practicality. It has served you well.
You make a fine example.
I don't know if I'm ready.
You have to be. We have to.
You are once again complete.
It's more than that. For the first time in a long time, I'm... myself.
You have found your center.
I have. For the first time in a long time.
So are you... all together now?
Are you... you?
For the first time in a long time, I am.
Thank you--for all you've done, and for all you've shown me.
Dark days lie ahead. The darkest days. If my error can't be undone, everyone will pay the price.
Brace for the worst....
It's over.
You've been at my heels far too long.
I knew the Rishi plan was a longshot, but I had to try. Had to make it legitimate. I needed to lure you in.
You were supposed to stay busy on Rishi long enough for me to finish here. But no, you couldn't do that, could you?
Not a chance.
You have underestimated me for the last time.
Wrath, you need to back down. You're too close to all this to see just how much is at stake.
Something you should understand when it comes to me: I don't dawdle.
No, apparently not. I thought you more than anyone would comprehend just how much is at stake.
Have you not seen a single holovid about me? Skimmed my bio, anything?
I'm not one of your pathetic bounties. Too much is at stake.
I never was much for keeping idle.
No, you're always out digging where you don't belong, aren't you? And you still don't see the whole story.
Give up while you still can.
You're impossible.
This has all been one big deception, hasn't it? You aren't even the man you claim to be.
You don't know what you're talking about.
I spent three hundred years in lock step with the Emperor's mind. I know what he's become, what he wants.
The Emperor must be destroyed completely or he will return and consume every last living thing!
There's no cost too great. If I have to snuff out every life on this world by hand to draw the Emperor out, then so be it!
You can't defeat him.
Even at his weakest, you are no match for the Emperor.
Have some common sense. The Emperor is the dark side incarnate. You wouldn't stand a chance.
Comes down to a fight between the two of you, I'll put every last credit on the Emperor.
You're mad to think you'd even stand a chance against his power. You're nothing to him.
If you're Revan, who spoke to me outside the temple?
Of course, it's so obvious now. You have no idea what I am, what I've become.
Whatever the Emperor's done or may wish to do, it's my place to handle it. Not yours.
You're so naive, Wrath. You don't even begin to comprehend what I've become.
This is your final warning....
Your warnings are meaningless to me. What I've become, you have no hope of stopping.
I was a Dark Lord of the Sith. I was the Prodigal Knight. I was powerful--but I was also weak. Not anymore.
Now I'm pure. Unburdened. I can finally have revenge on my jailer and save the galaxy doing it!
I have the power--and you have nothing!
You are wrong, Revan.
She has powerful allies.
He has powerful allies.
Both Sith and Jedi.
Allies from all corners of the galaxy.
We have your back, <FirstName>!
Shae Vizla?
Heard the fight to end all fights was going down. What sorry kind of Mando would I be if I missed out?
You were saying...?
I don't care how many of you there are. I won't be denied my destiny!
I am Revan!
Hahaha... hahaha!
What's happening?
Impossible... the ritual hasn't even begun....
The deaths you've caused. The war you've fueled. It is all mine.
This galaxy is mine. It's time I claimed it once more.
Is everyone all right?
Sound off. Any injuries?
That was... something. Everybody make it?
We're fine.
That was him....
The Emperor.
We stopped Revan. How is that possible?
The Emperor.
How is that possible? We stopped Revan.
He did not assume a physical form or possess a body. And he left as soon as he appeared. None of it makes sense.
Still packs a punch.
I think the droid took a bump.
The general is entirely misinformed, your imminence! A few coats of paint and I'll be ready for the Lunar Gala!
Looks like we weren't the only survivors.
He might be able to tell us more about what's happened.
I still don't understand. This looks like Revan, but so did the spirit.
All truth is revealed with time.
It's about time we finished this.
I've... failed....
As have I.
So many centuries. The Emperor and his Dread Masters, trying to wrench me apart, to unleash my anger and hatred....
I detached myself from the pain. Focused on the Force.
You hid behind Jedi platitudes! You weren't strong enough to survive the torture, or the battle in the Foundry. I faced them! I survived them!
You've carried on, dragging the remains of a body that should have long since faded to dust.
Hatred fueled cunning, but burned out all wisdom. Without me, you could not see.
Strength is useless without wisdom to guide it.
Strength is useless without some wisdom to guide it.
We need to repair what the Emperor has done.
And without him, you died. He needs your wisdom, but you need his strength. His focus.
Let me help you finish what we started.
Each part of you was needed as much as the other. The Emperor split you apart, because you were strongest when you were together.
That's why the Emperor tried so hard to split you up. Two pieces working separately aren't nearly as good as one whole, working together.
Together, we can prevail.
I am whole again... but there is much to do. The Emperor has returned. Steel yourselves against what will come.
Let's get back to basecamp. He was right--we have a lot to do.
You barely managed to drive me away last time. What makes you think you can survive against me?
Your entire armies barely managed to drive me back. You think you'll be able to face me without them?
The Force is not my only ally.
No soldier fights alone.
I have a feeling I'm not the only one who wants a crack at you.
Shae Vizla?
Wouldn't miss a fight this good.
Bring as many fools as you like. You won't stop what must be done!
You don't know what you're doing. The Emperor is too powerful!
No! Not any longer! I have set my will against this creature for centuries--only I can destroy him!
But you aren't Revan!
Who else could do what I've done? Who else would have a strength to come this far?
I am Revan. And I will complete the work I started so long ago.
Take a step back. Look at what you're doing.
You're only going to make the Emperor stronger. This is what he wants, don't you see that?
You understand nothing! I know his mind better than anyone living--I know what must be done!
I spoke to Revan's spirit. You can't be him.
Lies. You have been deceived.
Your time is long past. You don't belong here. You belong in the ground.
Not until he is gone forever!
Can't you see what you've become? Your hatred and regrets are consuming you.
My own flesh and blood, standing against me. The depths of his corrupting influence are endless.
I will waste no more time. This must end--now!
It... can't be....
You are sealing the galaxy's fate!
You cannot deny me!
I have come too far!
I must have my revenge!
This is my destiny!
This will be the end of you!
He is strong with the Force!
I will see you break!
It is over for you, Revan!
Grant me strength!
Revan, don't be a fool!
Press the attack!
Keep... fighting...!
Make him bleed!
Get him, Jakarro!
Hit him with everything!
Die already!
Jakarro? Jakarro, get up!
The Force is my servant!
Be strong!
So much power...!
That's all... I have....
Don't let up!
I won't let you win, Revan!
Let's go, people!
Tough sucker!
Have some more!
Love a good scrap!
Heck of a fight....
I... believe....
Our way is just!
Taste the power of Revan's path!
You will never defeat the true master!
The Order of Revan is everything!
My faith in Revan sustains me!
You are not strong!
Believe in the path of Revan!
It comes... to an end....
It is inevitable!
Be his sustenance!
All things must end!
You have no eyes!
In service of his glory!
Let the end begin!
The Emperor.... Must feed the Emperor....
They were Imperial Guards after all.
Yes; the support team says their commandant's a raving madman.
We'll want to question him. Insane or not, he'll be of use to us....
They're ruining everything! I see it. We see. But they don't see. They don't even have eyes!
We're all that's left. We have to flush the others from this place. Only then can we wake the starving Emperor and grant him sustenance!
Oh, thanks. Now I'm hungry.
Identify yourselves.
Lord Wrath! It's Lord Wrath!
I'm Commandant Iven. We're the true Imperial Guard. We're here to serve the Emperor.
You serve me now.
No, Wrath. Only the Emperor's will. The Emperor's needs!
Tell me what must be done.
We must cleanse the temple of the Revanites. We have to prepare the Emperor's feast.
Commandant Iven. Imperial Guard. We serve the Emperor. And you....
You're not one of them. You're... meaningless. Meaningless. Go away. Go.
If anyone's leaving this place, it's you.
We have to see it through. Through to the end.
I am a Dark Lord of the Sith, and you will address me as such.
It doesn't matter who you are. Even Sith. The Emperor! Only the Emperor.
I want to know what you're doing here. What are you planning?
The Emperor wants to destroy all life, yours included. You know that, right?
We're food. All life was born to be his food. The glorious honor!
And you don't have to do anything, Wrath. Just let us sacrifice you in his name. Food for the Emperor!
You can't stop it! We won't let you!
My death serves his will, as all do. We are the fuel. Our sacrifice ignites his blazing glory!
I see you've made a new friend.
This man is the only survivor of Revan's attack. We need to take him back to the camp for questioning.
Then we will.
Return to the camp. We have much to discuss.
Invaders! Interlopers! This world is off limits!
He told us from the start. Only the devoted! Only the purest! His orders, his command!
Stay calm. I didn't come here to hurt you.
Hurt me as much as you want! None of it matters now!
Are you talking about the Emperor?
Do not speak of him! You are cattle! Fodder for the greatness to come!
Great. Someone to question, and he's lost his mind.
No, no, I see clearly! His sight can never be lost!
You were attacked by the followers of a man named Revan. Do you know where he's gone?
To the temple. And from there, the final steps are walked. We have failed, but so will he!
Plans within plans, always! This too has been foreseen! All possibilities are witnessed and adjusted for!
What are you talking about?
The end is inevitable. All will be devoured to fuel his transcendence. All nations, all worlds, all species!
You, me, Revan... none will survive!
Lana here. I have an opportunity for us, if you're interested.
Go ahead.
There's a redundant monitoring subsystem in the equipment you're installing. You could activate the subsystem, setting it to track Republic chatter and movements.
Sneaky. I like it.
Can we set the backup system to help the main system do its job better instead?
Yes, in theory....
Then let's do that.
Okay, I'll walk you through the steps....
I finished planting the sensors.
Good work. Before you come back to base... I think an extra modification is in order.
With a few tweaks, we can set the sensors to forward us extra data on Imperial activities. They won't even know it's happening.
You want to spy on the Empire's forces.
I think recent events have taught us to keep an eye over our shoulder. We won't be doing anything to damage their capabilities--just staying informed on them.
If we don't show trust, we'll never keep a lasting truce.
You're serious? I guess I can't make you do the smart thing here....
Just... head back to camp. You're done out there. Theron out.
You don't have to convince me. Just walk me through the modifications.
All right. Start with the internal communications processor....
...That should do it. I'll scrub our chat from the comm log--you should get back to base. Theron out.
Hey. You okay? You look like me after we went out for shaclaw on Voss and you had to hold my lekku.
Whoa. You look like Jaesa did that time she tried exoboar soup.
I had a vision. There was a galaxy neighboring our own, and then... nothing.
Every star went dim, both in that galaxy and our own. The end of everything.
See? Probably just something you ate. Maybe? I hope?
Another galaxy? Would you say it was a dwarf galaxy?
Sorry, my lov--my lord, I didn't mean to eavesdrop.
Forgive me, my lord; I couldn't help but overhear.
A dwarf galaxy sounds right. What do you know?
There is such a galaxy off the Outer Rim, known as the Rishi Maze.
Rishi? I've heard of Rishi. It's a planet. Some kind of pirate resort? Sounds like a real dive. I've kinda always wanted to go.
We get strange datamails from Rishi. We do not ask for them. Offers of free travel.
You've started receiving these recently?
Yes. Sith understands. And there is no sender.
Quinn, set a course. We're going to Rishi.
Reach out with your emotions. Let them guide you.
Yes... that's it....
Ashara, tell me: what did you see?
It was... it was you. You were in a jungle. Roots and vines, they took you, bound you, and then....
You were torn apart.
You saw the future. One of many possible futures, but a probable one, at the very least.
Then I heard a voice. A woman. She reached out to me through the Force. She told me you had to go to Rishi.
I don't want you to go.
Rishi. You said Rishi?
Rishi's been coming up on the navicomputer. Thought it was some kind of glitch. Nothing out there but my kind of people.
That is no glitch. It is a message.
An invitation for you and me to go off on a little pirate holiday? Heh, no, I know better than that.
Let me guess: you're thinking of walking straight into a trap.
Perhaps it is a trap. What of it?
Tell the crew there's been a change of schedule. I should very much like to visit this "Rishi"....
It not Blizz's fault!
I know you did it, Blizz. I always catch you messing with stuff.
Blizz not know what Torian mean, but boss take love-love Torian word over Blizz any day.
Blizz not know what Torian mean. Blizz not mess with any stuff, ever!
Okay, you two. Someone care to explain?
Someone plotted a course on the Mantis's navcom without running it by anyone. We were about to make the jump when I caught it.
How Blizz do that? Blizz never even hear of... what planet name?
I don't think it was Blizz. In fact, I'm pretty sure it wasn't anyone on the ship.
Telling me we were sliced? How were you not on top of that?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe because you've been keeping me, uh, busy?
Never saw a data routine like it before. Looks like Republic spy stuff, but modified. And that's just part of it.
Been up on the Blacklist lately? Every listing claims Rishi was the mark's last known location, including....
A bounty. On him. Right.
Guess someone wants me to go to Rishi. Well....
What kind of gal would I be if I disappointed them?
What kind of guy would I be if I disappointed them?
Hey, agent. Was kinda hoping to find you in bed. Guess you're busy.
Hey, agent. Doing a little research, huh?
It's nothing that can't wait.
Well, good, 'cause I did that sweep like you asked. Found something.
What are we looking at?
A homing beacon sends a broadcast, not a direct signal, so we can't discover directly who's tracking us.
Transceivers along our route pick up the beacon's signal. If I triangulate the origin of someone collecting the beacon's data from those transceivers....
As ever, we are enthralled with your mind. But we don't believe we have ever heard of this planet.
We are impressed. But we don't believe we have ever heard of this planet.
Rishi. I know it. Pirates and all that. Never been, though.
Then it's your lucky day, Kaliyo.
We're going to Rishi.
Lord Wrath. Per your instructions, I am transmitting the navigational coordinates for the planet Rishi now.
You're mistaken. I haven't requested any navigational data.
I... oh. Rishi? Abrion sector? Outer Rim? No?
Please forgive this error, my lord. The computer system must have suffered a failure of some kind. It won't happen again.
Uh... good day, my lord.
That was no mistake. We must go to Rishi.
Greetings, my lord. It is an honor to provide the coordinates for the planet Rishi, as you requested.
I've made no such request.
I... hm. You have my sincerest apologies, my lord. We must be suffering from a computer error.
Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim... a very strange glitch. With your leave, I will investigate at once. Farewell, my lord.
If someone is trying to get my attention... they have succeeded.
Greetings... citizen. The navigational data you requested is being transmitted now: planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim.
What are you talking about? I never ordered any nav data.
Are you quite sure? I have your name and contact details listed quite plainly here.
Yeah. I'm sure.
Oh. Well, my apologies then. I won't trouble you any further--good day.
I'm either being messed with or sent a message--I don't care which. We're going to Rishi.
Good day, Commander. Per your request, I am transmitting all navigational information available for the planet Rishi.
I didn't request any navigational data.
I... hm. That's very strange. Your credentials and request are quite clear here: planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim.
Must be some kind of computer error. I will ensure that it doesn't happen again--apologies for the inconvenience, Commander.
"Computer error." No, I don't think so.
Very good.
Couldn't they practice with sticks or something? I'm not sure I'm equipped to reattach arms or legs or... heads.
The great Doc, not up to a real challenge? Thought your skills were second to none?
I never said I wasn't skilled, just that I'm not equipped. Uh... for that. Reattaching limbs.
It's a poor workman who blames his tools....
What's wrong? Are you all right?
Whoa... easy there. You're all right. What happened?
Master? Is something wrong?
I saw a planet. Far away, remote. And an island city.
Far-away planet = Rishi?
Coordinates for Rishi = entered into navicomputer // T7 = thought Master entered new destination
No... I didn't.
Wasn't me. I've never heard of the place.
A glitch? Sabotage?
Confirmation. We need to travel to Rishi, right away.
There is no emotion....
There is peace....
There is no ignorance....
There is knowledge....
Hey--sorry to intrude. But we have a situation.
That's all right, Felix. What's going on?
Master Jedi--apologies for the interruption. We have a situation.
What is it?
The navicomputer. Someone's tampered with it. Added a whole bunch of data about a planet called Rishi.
Nothing on Rishi but pirates and gunrunners. Slicing our computer would be out of their league.
Show me.
Are you okay? What happened?
Master? What is it?
A vision. This planet, Rishi... we must go there immediately.
Forty-eight... forty-nine... fifty! Just fifty more to go, soldier!
Formation of scar tissue was accelerated successfully. However, increased dialymph levels can also be observed, increasing risk of parasitic infections such as brainworm rot.
Yuun. What's our computer status?
Most circuits guide their charges harmoniously. But our navigation system shows the marks of outside hands.
The location of a remote planet, Rishi, has been added to our astrogation charts. Tampering attempts to alter our destiny.
Squad! We've got a situation.
Yuun found evidence of tampering in our navigation system. Someone added a planet: Rishi. Anyone else notice anything odd?
Rishi? I keep getting messages from guys I've served with, all saying they're retiring there. Seemed like a few too many for coincidence... maybe more tampering?
My research logs consistently enter the word "Rishi" in place of other planet names when I'm making entries. I submitted a 592-K about it a week ago....
The review of such documents was to be the next step in today's journey.
Someone's trying to point us at Rishi. Opinions?
Bypassing all of our computer security protocols would require exceptional intelligence. Such a person couldn't have believed we wouldn't notice.
Then they went to a lot of trouble to get our attention. Someone must want us there pretty bad.
Let's find out who. Prep your gear--I'm setting course for Rishi.
Blast... I'm just never going to win, am I?
Blast! Come on, how many hands is that?
He's just got that special something, Corso. Maybe you'll figure it out someday.
Do they play sabacc differently in your hometown? Maybe the numbers on this deck go a little too high....
Hmph. Better ways to spend my time.
Since the game's winding down... think I could borrow you for a minute? I think someone's tampered with the navicomputer.
Tampered with it? How?
I couldn't begin to guess. Every time I put in a course, it re-plots it to a planet at the very edge of the Outer Rim: Rishi.
Rishi? The pirate hideout?
So I've heard. It's not that we couldn't make some credits in that type of setting, but I prefer to have a choice in the matter.
Can we fix the thing?
Already done. But someone wants us on that planet. Some kind of subtle job offer?
Or a trap.
Either way, sounds like more fun than another hand of sabacc. Let's find out what Rishi has in store.
Ah, Master Jedi. Greetings.
I apologize for the delayed response. I've just transferred the navigational data you requested to your ship's systems.
Navigational data? What are you talking about?
Coordinates and hyperroutes for the planet Rishi? In the Abrion sector, the Outer Rim?
I didn't make any such request.
I... uh... hm. I apologize for the error, Master Jedi. Sorry to have wasted your time. Good day.
Sounds like someone wants us on Rishi. Let's go.
Good day, Master Jedi. I'm currently transmitting the navigational data that you requested.
What do you mean? I didn't request any navigational data.
You didn't? I have the order here... coordinates and hyperroutes for planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim.
Your name and contact information are all clear as day... how strange.
I'll look into the matter and see that it doesn't happen again. Apologies for the mistake--have a nice day, Master Jedi.
Curious. Let's investigate.
Hey there, Major. Just forwarding those navigational coordinates you requested.
I didn't request any navigational data. What are you talking about?
Are you sure... uh... sir? Planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim?
Never heard of it.
It's your name and contact information here... that's just weird.
Sorry to have bothered you. Must have just been a computer glitch. Have a good one, Major.
That might not have been a glitch after all. Wouldn't hurt to check it out.
Ah, hello there. You're a hard one to find, Captain.
Our office got that navigational data you requested. Forwarding now.
Navigational data? What are you talking about?
Planet Rishi? Abrion sector, Outer Rim? From the data we have, it's a popular spot for... independents, like you.
Popular or not, I never asked anyone for the address.
Weird. All of your details are right here... Sorry about the confusion. Have a good day, Captain.
Hey, I just had a great idea. Let's go visit a popular spot for independents--like me.

I'm transmitting the traitors' names now. They're part of a cult... the Order of Revan.
Revan? But he was killed....
Apparently it didn't take.
All ships, cease fire. Open a channel to the Imperial commander.
I've been listening. As ruses go, this is quite creative.
It's the truth. Round up the people from Theron's list and see for yourself.
And if you're correct? What do you propose?
A meeting. Face to face, on neutral ground.
There's a town on the surface: Raiders' Cove. We'll send coordinates for the meeting spot.
Very well.
I hope you know what you're doing....
Nice. I'm in. Uploading the files.

I am here. And you are on Rishi.
Darth Marr, you have traitors in your fleet. Scores of them, acting under orders from Revan.
Revan is alive?
He wants you to destroy each other up there.
Have the fleet power down all weapons. Do it now.
Your people should have a list of the traitors.
Finally, an open line.
Grand Master Shan. It appears we have been set upon each other by your ancestor.
Yes, we were notified by an agent of ours who's planetside. We're taking measures to detain the traitors among us.
As are we. Given the nature of the threat, I suggest we speak in person.
Very well. A neutral location.
There's a pirate town on Rishi. My team will send the coordinates.
That will do.
Don't know if you can read me, but I've arrived.
The jammer's in sight.
Perfect, and I just hit the jackpot--an exhaustive list of Revanite traitors on both fleets.
We read you.
I'll do what I can to guide you through, but that signal jammer might cause some hiccups.
Okay, you're in. There's a forcefield between you and that jammer. You'll have to gather a set of security codes to pass through.
Signal's going to start breaking up soon. Talk to you when you get that jammer shut down.
I will destroy you!
This is how it's done, Jos!
Valk! Like watching dust gather....
I've seen Jawas fight better, riduur!
My husband, the pushover!
When do you finally destroy them, huh?!
Together, we can't lose!
Let them have it!
Keep up, Valk!
Jos--you're doing it wrong!
Hit them!
Made it inside. Huh.
Don't know what you're doing in our compound, but since you're here, let's see what you're made of.
Well, look at you. Might actually be a challenge.
Hey, that was almost up to Mando standards.
What a mess! Nice one.
Not bad. But not done, either.
You're not giving up, are you? You're really going to see this through.
Done pretty well for yourselves, but you're in the arena now.
Meet Jos and Valk. Husband and wife. Tough as durasteel, undefeated, and still eager to prove themselves.
Have to hand it to you, that was something. Think it's time we met.
Not... bad....
Won't let you win!
I'm taking you down!

Playtime's over!
Now the real fighting starts!
No more practice!
Nar dralshy'a! Try harder!

Jate. Jate!
I thought you could fight!

I take it you're the one they call Torch.
Shae Vizla. That little nickname, the locals came up with.
Hell if I know why.
You recently had a falling out with the Revanites and the Nova Blades.
One Mandalorian to another, think you could help me out?
What, you think I didn't recognize Mand'alor's favorite champion? I might be off the grid these days, but I'm not thick.
I could use your help.
I'm sure you could, Jedi.
I bet you could.
Tell me everything.
Oh, tell you everything! Sure, of course, because I never had a Sith try to assert themselves before.
Think you could help me out?
Could? Yes. But will I, do I want to...?
Hoping for a professional courtesy, merc to merc? That's right, I know who you are.
Tell you what: instead of whatever grand gesture of cooperation you thought might happen here, why don't we try something a little different?
Been a while since I had a decent challenge. I'm taking this opportunity to show my clan how it's done.
Son of a....
Okay, so I'm a little rustier than I'd like to admit--but just a little. Felt good to be in a real scrap for once!
I'm impressed.
Flattery, huh? What the hell, I'll take it.
You got what you wanted. Time to return the favor.
Well, that would be fair, wouldn't it?
Let's finish it.
We aren't done. I still get to kill you and claim your clan.
Take it easy, champion. Seems to me you came here for another reason?
If I'm not mistaken, Mandalorian duels are meant to be to the death.
One: you aren't Mando; two: that was just a fun bit of sparring.
So--you know the Blades went and partnered up with the Revanites. Means you probably know they're up to no good.
We helped out the Blades to have a good relationship with Raider's Cove. We didn't sign up for the Revanites and their all-out war, so we bailed.
Tell me where the Revanites are, and what I'm up against.
Afraid I don't have the "where" to give you, but I can clue you in on the "what": a whole fleet of ships they've got parked somewhere around here.
Can I count on you and your clan to end the Revanite threat?
No, you cannot. We're not for hire, we're not Imperial lackeys, and we're not getting involved.
You will help me stop them.
All right, get your clan together and let's take it to the Revanites. The Empire'll pay whatever you want.
We're pretty well set here, thanks. Whole reason we came to Rishi was to avoid this stuff.
Put out the call to your clan. You fight for the Empire now.
Yeah, my days of working for the Empire are long gone.
Give me a single target that's worth my going toe-to-toe with, that's fine. But the Revanites and their fleet of warships? Pass.
Where are these ships?
Couldn't tell you.
I wouldn't mind it a bit if you chased the Revanites out of Rishi. Off-the-radar is just how we like it here.
Good hunting to you all.
Good hunting to you, Sith.
Re'turcye mhi, Mando. It was an honor to spar with you.
Good hunting, beroya. Always keep one eye on your employer.
Good hunting to you, stranger.
Ke'sush, Mando'ade! Who's up for a skar'kla hunt?
Heh... not bad....
...Not bad at all. Been a while since someone's given me a fight like that. You should be proud.
I can see how you earned your reputation.
Likewise. And speaking of earning things, I'd say you've earned a bit of intel for that performance. You were asking about the Revanites, right?
You're telling me this was all just a fun little sparring match for you?
Well, me, my clan, and our beasts... so I wouldn't call it "little," really.
Now then, I'd say you've earned some answers. It was the Revanites you were asking about, right?
I wonder how your helmet would look if I mounted it on my wall....
Now, now, we've had enough fun for one day. Didn't you come here for intel on the Revanites?
We were the ones who hooked them up with the Nova Blades. Even helped them win a scrap or two.
Once they started the secret-manipulating-all-out-war nonsense, I pulled us out. I've had my fill of war.
Did the Revanites tell you anything else about their plans?
Afraid not.
A Mandalorian who's tired of war? I thought fighting was your whole life.
Fighting, yes. War... I guess it depends who you ask. I think it's boring.
So all those years of murdering Republic soldiers and Jedi wore you down?
No such thing as murder in a war. That's part of what makes them so boring.
You spend most of your time waiting around between battles, and when they finally happen... it's just a bunch of random killing.
I prefer my fights sporting. Or at least interesting.
And the Revanites don't?
Nope. They stack the deck as much as they can.
I do know they've got a whole fleet of warships tucked away somewhere on this planet. Never gave me any real details or coordinates, but they're here.
If you want to find them and smash them up, more power to you. I liked this place a lot better before they showed up.
If you want to join the fight, you'd be welcome.
I'll keep it in mind. Pretty sure I've got enough to do around here, though.
Want to hand over a ride to replace the one you shot down?
Eh, plenty of speeders around this place. Take whichever you want.
If we ever fight again, you won't be walking away.
Aww. I like you.
Lets get you patched up, vode! I've been going too easy on you!
I'm not done yet!
...And that's how you keep your ship in order!
That's what you get, pirating from pirates!
Ravagers don't give up!
No more playing around!
You messed with the wrong spanner jockey!
Stop mending things!
Where are you stupid droids when I need you?!
We're all going to fry!
You're not taking my ship!
Let's go, losers!
Don't ever mess with an engineer!
I'll fix you!
You're all going down!
Had enough yet?
This is how we greet hijackers around here!
You're not the regular maintenance crew....
We don't have a regular maintenance crew! Just droids!
All right, you got me...
...but if I'm going down, you're going down with me! Haha!
To the end!
Hah! One-handed, even! One real hand, anyway....
Cannon fodder!
Boy, that one's a gusher! Hah!
Oh, you done it now!
You just asked for a whole new brand of whupping!
Been a blast, but it's over now!
This is the part where you finally die!
Nice try!
Aye! Now this is a fight!
Why've you got to ruin a perfectly good plan? Just die!
Your heads will make fine trophies! Haha!
I don't think so!
Let's see some blood!
Aw, what? Hurt your feelings? Got you all sad inside?
The Ravagers are mine again, that's all that matters! You're nothing more than cannon fodder!
It's like the Ravagers always say: "Why leave 'em alive when you can kill 'em?"
Hah! Like I'd really cut you people in anyway! But, hey, thanks for distracting Cora long enough for me to gain the upper hand! Haha!
I warned you not to cross me, Cora!
Ruugar! You miserable, flea-loving wretch!
Didn't think you'd hear from me so soon, did you? Wanted you to meet my new business partners! They're on their way right now! Haha!
You need to hop over to Coratanni's ship! Got to make sure that backstabber doesn't get away!
Okay, plan's coming together. Get at the heart of that tub and I'll do the rest.
You're in time for Bulo's weekly booze delivery to Raider's Cove. He'd enslave his own family to keep his shipments on schedule!
Love to see the look on his ugly mug when he sees you coming, that scum. Deserves whatever he's about to get.
Haha, good to be back.
I'll run this tub for you, get you up nice and close to Coratanni.
This is your captain, you lowly bunch of lowlifes--your real captain! I'm back, and either you're with me or you're overboard!
Here I come, Cora....
Great. Now I gotta do this myself.
Agh, come on!
Whatever you do, don't die!
Worse breath than a skar'kla!
Sparky's litter! They're always hungry!
Here come the young ones!
That's one tough hide, ain't it?
Whoa! Sparky's on the loose!
Just don't try petting that sucker!
Might want to watch out for Sparky. Even chained up, she almost made a meal of my hand once. The other hand.
Ah. So long, Sparky. You were a good girl, but it had to be done.
Get her! Get her!
You made Sparky mad!
Look out!
See, even the Ravagers' pets are bloodthirsty!
Sparky don't heel so easy!
She's on a tear!
Almost over for ol' Sparky...!
Don't make me call the boss over!
You think I'm tough, wait till you meet the boss!
Me = pirate legend // You = dead!
Me + Blaster = unstoppable!
Me = Ravager forever!
Yeah! Dispatch those dunderheads, boss!
You dunderheads, no one takes on us Ravagers and lives!
Operation: Dunderhead Dispatch is go!
The boss told me to mess you up but good. You're in for it now!
Let's put them secondary systems to work!
Don't worry, I got more for you!
Well, well--we got us a proper fight!
